author: {'steamid': '76561198142275624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1692400952}
review:
Holy hell. Can't get past the first screen. 
I go to pick up the key to open the door, the name of the key pops up but there is still a question mark where the item should be. Maybe its just like that- and so I go to the door, and I watch my ugly mentally challenged potato punch at the door for 3 minutes. Okay, maybe I'm doing something wrong here, where is my key- I go to my inventory, no key. Glitch? Bug? No clue. I go back to the question mark where this key should be, I press the only button to pick it up, the name of the item pops up as though I have picked it up, and its not in my inventory.

Now I understand learning a new game. I googled, binged, yahoo'd, used steam boards for any information on this game, looked on youtube for help, read other reviews on the game and common bugs- nothing. Literally crumbs of information.

Nobody cares about this game, and if it's 7 years old and STILL nobody cares, screw it. 

Oh, and it says I've played 5 hours, when I've literally opened it up and spent almost 40 minutes trying to figure something out that might be my own impatience, might be a bug, but honestly if you look at the game for 2 seconds after logging on for the first time, you get it. 

Try it, hope its fun, but its a "no" for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034179985', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 35910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15318, 'last_played': 1690334969}
review:
If you're familiar with RuneScape, then this game might seem like an alternate-dimension version of RuneScape to you.
You have combat, gathering skills, creation skills, RNG loot, long grinds, and the PvP area called the Boneyard, where a lot of endgame content lies if you feel brave to try it.
The Orake Wiki helps a lot with learning how the game works and what does what.
I'm playing pretty consistently right now, and you can check who is all online by typing /who into chat and pressing enter. I'm always willing to help some new players out, so if you see me online, switch to global chat with F1 and say hello. :) The game is good, I swear.
Took a year and a half break, and the same people are still online grinding away! Very helpful folks, too. Don't forget to join the discord!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980461992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 52269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46769, 'last_played': 1695374351}
review:
Definitely is a great game to get into if you enjoy loot based and praying to RNGesus. The community is also great and I would suggest joining the discord. There are a lot of people on the discord that are extremely helpful and willing to assist even the most junior of players.

I played quite a few hours of this game and will be playing much more in the future. :)

review:
Fun game to play, lots to do and to explore. The community is small but friendly and I recommend joining the discord.
I had fun running around mining and killing things for food and then harvesting and making some potions. A friendly player gave me some advice and the 4 hours I played flew by so quickly. Very peaceful chill game to play!

Note:
If you have any problems launching the game or Orake wont launch , go to the file directory and run the runtime file to install the dll files needed and it will run sweet.
If you can't log in or the registration isn't working the server might need be refreshed, I mentioned it in the discord and the devs got back within 10 minutes and I could play :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198866942343', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 473, 'playtime_forever': 1674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1670, 'last_played': 1598172800}
review:
Orake is a classic RPG experience in a massively multiplayer setting, requiring a mixture of strategic character planning as well as some, albeit limited, reaction-based gameplay mechanics. The graphical style is simple but charming, with lots of unique areas to explore. For those seeking long-term progression, this game offers that, but it is also quite grindy.

As far as retro-inspired graphics and gameplay free-to-play MMORPGs go, this is one of the better ones on the market. Definitely recommend to those seeking that style of experience. However, for those seeking a true sandbox experience a la Ultima Online, Orake is likely to leave a bit to be desired.

Overall, one of the better MMORPGs I've played and given it's free -- it's definitely one I would recommend checking out for anyone who is a fan of the genre and not too deterred by the simplistic aesthetics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036990206', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1586109333}
review: This game is cool but also has a few issues that are tedious and annoying. For example, I started playing and i got a drop for a better weapon, when I had my mouse over the better weapon it literally said "Can use, No stat requirements". But then when I go to equip it, I don't have the required stats. And I can't figure out where the stat requirements are for items. Also the map is weird. I had such a hard time finding anything at first. Still have difficulty navigating at times. This may be an unpopular opinion but they need to add an option for auto attacking/ gathering. Currently you have to hold F or Ctrl to do them. But if you're going to be a game inspired by RS then why have that tedious feature. Also when banking multiple items, allow the space bar to be used as enter, it's annoying when you're taking out a lot of noted items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103874486', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1583680942}
review:
From first few hours of gameplay all I can say that if feels like an early version of runescape (pre runescape 2). Graphics are not great, not much of a story, not much info in general, very small playerbase, ect.
It's pretty much a nostalgia fuel in "mmo"rpg form.
But it's fine for what it is.
Since i got more into podcasts and audiobooks, this looks to be my next grind game.
I would not recommend this for a lot of people (especialy if you never played early mmos or you dont have much free time), but for those who want this kinda thing, it's perfect.

P.S. About those negative reviews about bad devs/staff - game has changed hands a few times and at least right now everything seems fine, haven't seen/experienced anything bad, but i'll update my review later if i see anything...

author: {'steamid': '76561197963532042', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1633177396}
review:
Actually a lot better than the other reviews claim, it felt similar to runescape but in a more compact and simplified manner. The map isn't as big and things aren't as spread out so there is a lot less running around. Not to big a player-base (at time of review) so there isn't really a pvp aspect, but in my own personal opinion I think the combat system would be a little too clunky for pvp anyways. It was really easy to get into this game its fun to dump time into for sure! I recommend trying it out when I started I was greeted with a very nice and helpful community it seems everyone knows everyone due to the size of it.

Most of the bad reviews are about terrible owners but it seems there has been a major change in staff.
Every staff member I spoke with was helpful and kind :)
Hope to see you around!

author: {'steamid': '76561198834470871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3104, 'last_played': 1695948921}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991156022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 25466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25403, 'last_played': 1583547436}
review:
Do you see all my playtime up there it's all gone my account got deleted. I got scammed by the game owners.

I started playing the game back then when Adam was the owner of the game, I made the wikia of the game, supported the game and got my lifetime membership. 

There was one guy who was constantly crashing the server because the game is build from a stolen engine called [url=https://imgur.com/e0mVmTS] Resbak[/url], the same engine is also used in another game called Life Forge anyway. 

When Adam sold the game the new owners of the game decided to change the name from "Orake 2D MMORPG" to "Orake Classic" then all the account was gone deleted including all the purchase and time that people have invested. 
I still have all my stats+bank screenshots from my old account because I somehow knew this was gonna happen.

Even thought I provided every proof they dont acknowledge my screenshots neither my membership, I basically got scammed. Also most of the stuff ingame are behind a membership paywall just in case you didn't know. Stay away from this game if you really do not want to get scammed like me.
developer_response:
Hello there. Adam has not been the developer for nearly 2 years. You can tell because that was the one of the original GUI chat bars. As the new team of developers, we do not perform nor condone this type of exchange.

Edit (in response to OP changing their review):

Hello again, Mechant. As we've already explained to you in our Discord when you brought this concern to us, the engine that Orake Classic is based on is open-source and has been since 2016, and updated version can be obtained from here: 
https://github.com/abhijeetviswa/Eclipse-Worlds
You may also see various custom versions of the engine on this website: 
https://www.ascensiongamedev.com/forum/46-other-game-engines/

We understand your frustration with purchases and game progress you've made in the game while it was in the hands of the previous developers (we are also veteran players of Orake when it was owned by the last two owners, Adam and Smoot). Unfortunately, the last owner had wiped all the accounts in an attempt to make a free-to-play version of Orake (known as Orake Reborn) while developing a sequel, before selling the game to us. So, we have no power in re-obtaining your accounts. 

Pertaining to the lifetime membership issue, we (and even the last owner) do not offer it because it is not a good economic model, especially for us as independent developers. Frankly. it is not up to us to honor the deals you've made with the last owners. However, we do offer some membership to those who did buy this in the past as a sign of good faith, as we have already offered you given proof of purchase. 

The last part of your updated review is incorrect. All content is accessible to everyone, free-to-play players and members alike. Membership provides a means to travel around the world quicker and support us in further developing the game with content the players want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072471025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6663, 'last_played': 1663726791}
review:
Before you dismiss this game based off of any negative reviews, HOLD UP! 

There has been a change in ownership a few times, and most of the negative reviews come from either: not knowing how to install the game, or previous issues with former owners.

In the game's current state it is a fun MMO that is reminescent of Runescape, Ultima Online, and Tibia. The game is now owned by veteran players and the community behind them is fantastic. It's not a perfect game by any means, but it's a game that has managed to win me over time and time again.

If you like anything that you see, just give the game a chance. I promise there is something for everyone.

And if you don't like what you have experienced, a sequel is in the works! So don't give up hope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095439527', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 39439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36127, 'last_played': 1612620059}
review:
I've played this game for a few hundred hours by now, and I really love this game.
Orake is the text-book example of an indie MMORPG. Originally created by a developer wanting to create his own MMORPG.
The original owner of this game is no longer around and the game has now been bought by some of what used to be the core players of Orake.
I've played on and off since 2017, and I have to say that this games current state is better than it has ever been in terms of content.
The new developers really care for the game, in a way that the past owner never did. Lot's of energy and passion has gone in to this game during the past 6 months. 

It's not perfect, not even remotely close to perfect. It's a very flawed game.
It's pretty buggy and the balancing is a mess, but none the less it's a great game!
The way you progress through Orake is satisfying as hell, It's very grindy but not as grindy as other MMORPGs out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133691327', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1527420589}
review:
Original Game Do Not Steal™ is a reskinned and badly modded version of another mmo that uploaded its source code as it shut down called ResBak Online that is long gone by the time you read this dont worry you're not missing much the game was bad and buggy the moderators were toxic and abused their power the person who posted this thing sent his gestapo to spam your profile and banned you ingame if you dared to say anything bad about his Original Game Do Not Steal™ all of this combined caused the fanbase to be very small and EXTREAMLY dedicated to the point that they are still begging for Orake or a Orake remake
This thing is (permanently?) shutdown due to the person who made it not knowing how to maintain a server so dont even bother downloading it the thing wont work.
developer_response:
Sorry you went through that with the original owner. As you said, ResBak has released its source to the public, so it was available for anyone to use and make games with! I don't see anything wrong with upcoming developers. 

However, the game has gone through a couple of owners. The newest owning team have been working on tons of bugs and updates for the game and we expect it to re-release soon! Join the Discord for the quickest updates on the game: https://discord.gg/yzbRwJK

author: {'steamid': '76561198051497554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1682052860}
review:
Once a game brimming with promise, "Orake" has sadly devolved into a shadow of its former self. Its history of multiple ownership changes has left it languishing in a state of neglect and disappointment.

Fading Glory:
In its earlier iterations, "Orake" radiated potential and passion. Today, however, the game's allure has diminished, leaving players disheartened by the evident lack of care.

Monetization Mishaps:
The game's monetization strategy has taken a perplexing turn for the worse. The formerly accessible in-game cash shop now stands as a broken relic, and players are forced to navigate a bewildering maze of manual payments through external platforms like Discord.

Technical Turmoil:
Beneath the surface, "Orake" is riddled with technical problems that cripple the overall experience. Glitches and bugs run rampant, disrupting any hope of smooth gameplay. Moreover, the decision to incorporate copyrighted music from unrelated franchises is a jarring reminder of the game's lack of attention to detail.

Visual Chaos and Design Lapses:
A once-cohesive visual design has fallen into disarray, with newer mobs clashing against the established aesthetic. The baffling inclusion of non-animated images as in-game entities, like the incongruous "Goku," shatters any semblance of immersion. And music stolen from the Final Fantasy franchise and others.

Creative Stagnation:
"Orake" struggles under the weight of its own creative stagnation. The absence of fresh ideas and innovative concepts hampers player engagement, resulting in a game devoid of a clear identity.

Frequent Downtime and Server Woes:
The game's foundation is alarmingly unstable. Frequent server crashes disrupt player experiences and undermine the game's potential. The continuous downtime not only erodes immersion but also reflects a lack of commitment to stability.

Conclusion:
"Orake" serves as a cautionary tale of potential squandered. Mismanagement, technical inadequacies, creative stagnation, and the perplexing use of unrelated copyrighted music have collectively led to the game's current dismal state. This review stands as a plea for the revival of "Orake" from the depths of mediocrity, with the hope that it can recapture the essence of its promising beginnings and deliver an engaging experience worthy of players' time and dedication.

O jogo é bem interessante. Peca em alguns quesitos de tutorial. Uma pessoa que não possuir uma base de jogos do gênero levará um bom tempo até que consiga jogar. 
 É imprescindível que em mmorpg haja certas descrições de suas missões, apesar disso, o game conta com uma jogabilidade bem dinâmica e seus gráficos são bem simplista. Ampla é a variedade de itens. 
   Veredicto - Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179666811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 44073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25368, 'last_played': 1690943365}
review: I have played this game for around 2-3 weeks already so I've got a pretty good grasp on controls and pretty good understanding on what the community is like. All i have to say is that the community is very helpful and nice. Very willing to assist new players and answer questions. The best part of the game is guilds by far because there is alot of group activity and not the mention freebies :P. This game is a give and take. When you give to others, they give back. This game has a very strong community built on helping each other out. There hasn't really been an issue with botting and scamming, so that is good. That is how the game should be. Should really give this game a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198099869381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2058, 'last_played': 1529504409}
review: Habe dieses Spiel jetzt ein paar Tage angespielt und muss ehrlich sagen, dass hinter der vermeintlich "einfachen Grafik" ein Spiel mit tiefem Inhalt steckt! Der Leveling-Prozess ist sehr ausgeglichen, wobei man auch bei höheren Skill-Leveln nicht verzweifelt, da kein Fortschritt. Die Quests sind tatsächlich herausfordernd und nicht wie im typischen "Durchschnitts-RPG" (Töte 250 mobs, von denen Du 10 gleichzeitig bekämpfen kannst!). Das Craften ist leicht verständlich, wenn auch leicht zeitaufwendig, da jeder Gegenstand einzeln hergestellt werden muss; In Anbetracht an das echte Leben, aber defiitiv ein Plus, sodass hohe Produktionsgeschwindigkeit damit wirkungsvoll unterbunden wird! Alles in allem ein sehr gelungenes Spiel, mit dem man sich effektiv die Zeit vertreiben kann, welches großes Suchtpotential hat. Es hat noch Platz für Optimierungen, aber welches Spiel hat das nicht? Sehr empfehlenswert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978011907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 114725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112707, 'last_played': 1528260143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198143196376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2386, 'last_played': 1629252568}
review:
Where should I start off.... I've only played 2 days and I'm already hooked! The game has a solid foundation at the beginning, and makes sure the players know exactly what they're doing through a Tutorial Island styled location.  Additionally, the playerbase is friendly, and willing to help whoever has a question.  There is also an extensive Wiki Page that allows you to get information on demand.  

The game is full of skills that allow players to either be a skiller, PvMer, or a combination of both.  It gives off a Runescape type of vibe, but without the bots and gold farmers included.  They are good at catching bots, and it is definitely not a P2W game.  The only things you can get with membership are teleports and cosmetics, but it doesn't help boost a persons XP P/H etc. If you were worried about IRL money making your experience any less meaningful, don't worry about that on this game.  The only point of membership and tokens with IRL money is too look badass and have faster travel.

Lastly, the lore of the game keeps you engaged, and there are tons of skills and quests that make it seem like you do something new everything, definitely would rate this 10/10 and would recommend to anyone looking for a new Classic Style RPG game experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198134112328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2521, 'last_played': 1696702208}

author: {'steamid': '76561198203622980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3472, 'last_played': 1529571280}
review: I tried this game a couple years ago and only put about a solid hour into the game. I decided to re-download it and give it another try. After completing their new tutorial which was much better than it used to be, the best aspect of this game became apparent immediately. Which is the community! Every seasoned player in this game has never had a problem stepping away from their own game time to help you with questions, or just chat in general. The game I can compare it to the most is runescape classic. This game has the same oldschool feel that I love. It's totally free and I would recommend it to any fan of oldchool rpgs or games in general. But the currently small but dedicated community, and oldschool appeal makes this game want me to come back for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198203571593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4175, 'last_played': 1585018689}
review:
Good Day,
Been playing this for about what looks like 24 hours.  It took a little to get used to some of the controls etc. but overall I think this is a GREAT game.  The community, if you take the time to chat and talk with is 2nd to none.  Everyone I have ran into has been extremely helpful.  It's excatly what I was looking for in a game lately.   Since I've played they have already put out a patch and the developers have been great to talk with and everything suggestion wise.  I play on the PVE server and love that they don't force PVP on you as well.  I just like doing my own thing when I want and helping others and doing group stuff when you want to.  I believe it's only going to get better!  Can't wait to grow with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068187370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1525825242}
review:
A buggy, clunky, amateur programming student project at best.

If you have ever played a game like RuneScape, or any similar MMO, be prepared to play what seems to be a junior developer's attempt to recreate it in less than a few weeks.

Graphics, while I understand aren't prioritized, are bad. Not in the sense that they are 8-bit style, but the textured used make finding things difficult. There is too much going on in certain towns, and the colors don't mix well. In some places, it takes a moment to see where your character is s tanding, because the colors are vomit on the screen -- NOTHING POPS OUT, very bland.

If this game was created as a project, to see if the developer could create something technically considered an MMO, then I applaud them. Good job, I hope you improve.

However, the developer seems to consider this a final piece, as there is already "membership" and payment options. I bet one or two membership payments cover the cost of the art in this entire game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030728359', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1520373174}
review:
This game might be a clone of Runescape, I'm not sure though because I can't get it to work.  I played the game for a few hours the night I installed it, the next day I ran into a white screen that stopped the game from opening.  This white screen issue is pretty frequently talked about in the discussions forum and their "solution" is to reinstall the game.

Well I followed the steps and nothing worked, I tried verifying the files too, each reinstall comes up with missing files...Their solution thread also says contact staff for more asssistance, I posted in the thread and have gotten no responce, someone else has a post in the discussions page itself that has gone unanswered since the end of January (it's March currently).

Buggy game with no support, if it works for you congrats...I hope it keeps working.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315063098', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 10621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3214, 'last_played': 1607189382}
review: The best game ever, the people were so nice and friendly, and it gives a certain sense of nostalgia, it also has several different skills and money making methods as well as a grand exchange of its own

author: {'steamid': '76561198173602043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2391, 'last_played': 1627845283}
review:
Orake, it's a 2D mmorpg for heck sake! 

    -This game, like most mmorpgs, has its pros and cons. You need to come into the game with the mind set that there are quests that require you to gather things and turn them in, some grinding of mobs for loot/quests, non-forgiving PvP (only in designated pvp zones that you won't just wonder into), and a skilling system that requires you to level up a gathering skill to increase a crafting skill. Those are the key elements of this game, that I have taken in over my 35 hours within the game.
 
    -The combat leveling system reminds me of Runescape Classic, by that I mean you have a total combat level that is increased by leveling Archery, Sorcery, and Attack. Currently, my character has 22 Archery, 5 Attack, and 2 Sorcery. My total combat is 13. My goal is to get Archery as high as I can, and keep Sorcery/Attack as low as I can in order to keep my total combat level low. It really reminds me of a "pure build" in Runescape Classic. I don't know if this is effective or not, but it is how I am choosing to leveling, which is a point I want to make.. the game lets you level how you like. 

   -The quests are not reinventing the wheel, but they do tend to be a little more indepth than just collect this by killing this 100 times. Another aspect of the game I find refreshing is that there are always game mods in the game, or at least I have always been able to find one in the major cities. They will ask for suggestions and comments on features of the game, and I have seen the changes they have made in the game based off of what players have suggested. The game is still in development, afterall. 




    -Tldr; It's free to play with a membership feature that unlocks some cute/convenient features, only requires a small download/older computers can run the game effectively, nice/supportive community/mods/programmers (unless you get on the global chat network to make a fool of yourself or try to ruin the experience for others [ you will be attacked and sent the depths of hell if so, ><" ]), interesting PvP system, and customizable leveling. Hope to see you in game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198213657861', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 22253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16156, 'last_played': 1624377140}
review: listen up. it's a good game with seemingly new developers. yes they are learning and yea it can get annoyying if something goes wrong. it's not easy to make a good game. this is a game worth investing sometime in. yea there have been foul ups but like i said the team working on the game is learning so i feel like as long as they continue to work and learn the game will grow to be alot better then it is. favorite things for me are... simplicity. after the begining of touch and go understand of how things work you will find your self smoothly and instinctivly working thru the game. my only qualm is there needs to be a bit my story to it. maybe relate queast together better. other then that i love it. really fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395344121', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 68964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60922, 'last_played': 1689541710}
review:
[b]Orake: Top Class MMORPG[/b]

Orake is a growing completely free-to-play MMORPG with a classic pixel feel for the PC (all in-game items with stats can be obtained for free - only purchased items are cosmetic). Players can choose to focus on developing various combat styles, non-combat skills, PVP, trading on the Market or just exploring the constantly expanding world with friends.

Graphics: 9/10 (love the simple pixel graphics style)
Music: 8/10 (good music - volume normalization improving)
Cinematics: 8/10 (attack and movement animations are great - more story line cinematics would be great)
Story: 8/10 (fun map and boss progression)
Content: 10/10 (so many diverse skills to develop, fun places to explores, puzzles to solve, and bosses to loot)
Controls: 9/10 (super smooth controls that are easy to use with a keyboard)
Gameplay: 10/10 (leveling is lively and fun even for seemingly simple skills like alchemy)

The content in the game is already quite extensive and is constantly expanding with hidden content and fun quests. Active mods help maintain the fun playing atmosphere of the game and are available to help answer questions. The developers are open to suggestions and really care about the community. Regular events provide ways to get fun cosmetics for free.

Fantastic, addictive game with a great community =D come check it out for yourself!

Overall: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970026386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1699708115}
review:
I played this game for quite a bit and the game has some serious, SERIOUS flaws. 

I've had plenty of crashes, bugs and issues, one thing is that on my laptop the game won't allow me to walk into member area, it just crashes, it also auto crashes if you have an unstable internet connection (wifi) instead of just having you lag out for a couple of seconds it auto closes the client...

If one of the two servers ever go down, you don't get auto kicked so your character is just stuck there, not letting you login on the other server.
Sometimes, the server crashed and it would be down for several hours and the admins were terrible at communcation so they wouldn't say anything at all their players were asking what was going on in Discord.

They introduced a marketplace where you could sell your items, you were limited to 2 items per character and server.
I lost  8 out of 10 items I tried selling on market, which was more than 10mil gold, and every single message about it was ignored, I was already bored of the game at that point since it seriously lacks content, the map is definitly not big enough to support a bigger playerbase so it's pretty reasonable that at most there were 20 "players" online - a lot of bots. 

When you create an account the Account name and passwords are stored inside readable textfiles that Admin has access to.

There is no Lost password option, Admin has to search for your acc/pw through the files so you have to get in contact with someone through discord or skype (usually Adam), who is never there.

When you buy membership (which is essentially -- access to a second bank and a teleport room for quick access), this also has to be given out by Adam, it's not an automatic transaction. 

Same goes with any other donation purchases. 

There is something called a Bless, that increases the servers experience gain rate for a set amount of time, (1 hour per bless). 

This was given out during US time always since the admins are from the US, it was usually given out as compensation because the server crashed maybe 1-4 times per day, most every day. 

I really gave the game a lot of slack cause I thought it was new but hearing that some ppl had been playing it for a year aleady, I understood it was a side project / forgotten hobby at most at this point. 

Edit: I played it off steam because I don't generally use steam, I probably have more hours than I'd like to, I have done most shit the game has to offer, which isn't a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035465881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1517633317}
review:
Dear future player,

I recently found this game in my suggestions on steam this week. I tend to ignore suggestions.. but its a free game might as well give it a shot, right? Now I personally try to ignore reviews before playing a game. I like to experience a game for myself and form my own opinion. [spoiler] Now regret my decision to not heed the warnings after seeing this game is mixed for all reviews, and very negative for recent posts.[/spoiler] So I instantly went ahead and downloaded the game. I was maybe a minute or two into the tutorial and someone named red something appeared and stood there maybe 30 seconds before I got booted from the game...  I instantly tried to login again only to find out I was banned.

After reading alot of the reviews it seems they have a huge issue with moderation, and falsely banning people without warning. It really saddens me to see how all the reviews seem to paint the same picture and the developer's response to a majority of them all is to blames the players... 

I will check back in the near future to see if any changes are made to their choice in staff. As for right now I will be keeping my review as a negative till they can prove to care for their player base, and get the bad eggs out of their ranks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079442322', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1537422823}
review:
Old Review 
"Banned for questioning the creativity behind the brilliant minds that named a red dinosaur mob, a "Redasaurous". The game itself probably isn't that bad, but if you want a feel at how the devs operate, that's it. If you want to play a game like Runescape, play Runescape or Albion Online. Nothing special here. ANY criticism is not welcome whatsoever, and is threatened with a Ban or Mute. I could really go on and on here with how poorly handled this all is and why you shouldn't get involved, but really, you'll find out for yourself if you play for more than an hour."

New Review
So this project has changed hands to someone that at least appears competent. I'll be changing this review as to give him a fair shake, and will update it when I've played a bit more. Unfortunately bans do not work as intended, and only check for returning users, so I can easily create a new account and test the game out again. Hopefully I can attest to the upgrade in quality and management when it's been updated a few times, until then, I'll keep my eyes and ears open.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115018661', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1517066657}
review:
[h1]Achtung in dieser Review könnten Spoiler vorhanden sein, außerdem besteht sie aus meiner persönlichen Meinung![/h1]

Über das Endgame und die langzeit Spielerfahrung kann ich leider nichts sagen, das schon mal vorweg. Ich habe das Spiel angespielt und werde es wohl nicht weiter spielen. Zunächst ist das Spiel sehr übersichtlich, die meisten Mechaniken sind sehr Logisch und schlicht gehalten, eigentlich ist das ganze Spiel schlicht gehalten. Die Texte sind auch für Englischschwache Spieler gut verständlich und die Atmosphäre ist eigentlich recht stimmig. Das Spiel wirkt teilweise etwas der Zeit hinterher, was nicht zwingend schlecht sein muss manche suchen ja genau sowas ein richtiges Retro Spiel was man mit Freunden spielen kann. Wirklich gestört hat mich nur das man weder die Auflösung noch die Tastenbelegung verändern konnte oder ich war nur zu blöd dazu es zu finden, es gab sehr wenige Spieler soweit ich das gesehen habe, aber das Spiel läuft konstant und gut. Wie gesagt die Mechaniken sind einfach zu versteh und umzusetzten auch wenn man sich an das Gameplay und die Bewegungen erstmal gewöhnen muss. 
Mein Fazit ist man kann Orake 2D spielen und für Interessenten sicher einen Blick wert vorallen da es ja auch Kostenlos ist.

Persönliche Wertung:
Grafik: 5/10
Sound: 7/10
Steuerung: 3/10
Story: -/-
Schwierigkeitsgrad: 5/10
Atmosphäre: 6/10
Humor: 5/10
Spaß: 5/10
Wiederspielwert: ?/10
Bonuspunkte: + Online spielbar

Gesamt: 6,1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198270933408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4067, 'last_played': 1511755693}
review:
I would like to say this game is great almost like a runescape/diablo style game. Early lvls seem to go by quick helpful community (for the most part). Only problem I have with the game is that at this moment its hard to jump in starting so late from others. Most of the high lvl players are great people, helpful and willing to give advice on how to play, but there's a huge problem with most of the middle of the pack players. 

A lot of the skilling is pretty decent and enjoyable just wish there were more places to mine/fish as a lot of new players are all trying to use limited amounts of spots.

Putting asside my problems with a certain player named Angry Wizard/Boots for being a spoiled brat. This game seems to be going in the right directions for the most part.

I can't recommend this game due to the people who most likly will ruin your experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406112847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1511655306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198143597836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9380, 'last_played': 1596890937}
review:
Played this gave for 140 hours, was going great. The owner told me to PVP and record it so I did, encouraged others to join me etc. On my birthday, after I told him etc he messages me on discord to stop being an "Annoying fuck" and "harrassing people". The owner Adam sent me this. In game, you have people like Angry Wizard who troll people and then act innocent, and screen shot perfect moments of you telling them to leave you alone as he whines to others.

Community is great, game play is great, but the owner doing this and someone basically trolling me for a day had me giving all my stuff away and not playing anymore. 

I do not recommend supporting the owner, so I do not recommend supporting the game. I helped maybe 100 new people and  was the reason for some of them getting memberships. I volunteered to help test the game and I even uploaded videos on Youtube. My in game name was Evil Morty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076473354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2265, 'last_played': 1512103147}
review:
Being an "old timer" I grew up with 8-bit games.  This game totally reminds me of Zelda while not being Zelda.  Side to side, top to bottom screen action.  If Zelda ever got on upgrade in the 8-bit generation, I think that this would have been one of the ways to go.

PvP needs some attention though, very unbalanced - I have a Socerer that is level 43 (level 27 toon) and I went up against a level 30 Melee - I couldn't get a spell off and he shredded me :(  I should have been able to cast some spell at least.  

Saghalie

review: บอกได้คำเดียวว่า เมื่อคุณได้เล่น จะทำให้คุณรับรู้ถึงการย้อนอดีตไปในยุคแห่งจินตนาการและความฝันในอดีตอันไกลโพ้น สมัยที่เครื่อง Computer ยังใช้ระบบปฎิบัติการ Windows 98 ซึ่งบรรยากาศที่ได้มันช่างทำให้เรากลับไปเป็นเด็กในสมัยนั้นอีกครั้ง (อุ๊ย! รู้อายุหมด คริๆ) ต้องลองเล่นดู ไม่ใช่ทุกเกมส์ที่จะให้ความรู้สึกเช่นนี้ได้โดยเฉพาะเกมส์สมัยใหม่ที่เน้นกราฟฟิก เปรียบเหมือนเหล้าใหม่ขวดสวยๆ แต่สำหรับเกมส์นี้เปรียบได้กลับเหล้าเก่าแสนกลมกล่อมแต่ขวดเหล้าแสนธรรมดา^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198038940039', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 301912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37506, 'last_played': 1606875308}
review:
Great game
Great community
Great new owners
F2p if you wish and not pay to win

What more do you need? 

I have played this game on and off for 3 or so years.

The new owners are also doing a great job at patching bugs from before and making new content!!

review: This game is increadably addictive. Its xp curve is fairly linear until the top levels (from what i have heard). It seems to share alot of core aspects with Runescape but has a more in depth combat system and more promise for both PVP and PVE given enough time for content. Runs smoothly with only occasional crashes due to the early nature of the game and small core development team. Keep up the great work admins and pick up this game for sure if you think its up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407739053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3551, 'last_played': 1515213614}
review:
I will leave an honest review as to why I think you shouldn't play at all.
I have lost count on how many times the server has rerolled my stats.

If you happen to jump from server 1 to server 2 in order to farm maps 
or resources. There will be times where you can spend 3-4 hours raising
your stats, log out and come back in to find yourself in the same place 
you started. For example I did a 3 hour session on gathering / alchemy 
and raised it about 5 points each. When I logged back the server restarted
my stats and all my progress had been lost. I put up with this the first time
but this has happened now 3 times. Its annoying as hell and someone in 
game mentioned that there is a certain bug when jumping from server 1
to 2 that causes this. Most decent spots for gathering in server 1 are taken
so if you want to jump to server 2 do it at your own risk. 

Personally I can't play knowing that couple hours can potentially be wasted
on bad coding. I met a couple people that this has happened to already
by the way. 

Play it if you want but your reward at the end of the day could be a reroll 
leaving you back at square 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077792180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 938, 'last_played': 1513669246}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071533584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1510124246}
review:
Personally if you like these types of games then by all means go and play it.

I like the game, however I dislike the team developing it. After trying to reach out to them on how to make their game look a little bit more professional in terms of their dialogue, naming of items or even monsters, they gave me absolutely no response and just simply deleted comments I posted & removed the news page with the suggestions on it.

- Example - 

Why not find a better name for new items, instead of taking a staff and just naming it "Strong Healing Staff"? 

Or 

For your new NPC's you bring into the game don't just generic name it "Blue Goblin and Blue Slime" even the town sounded very generic and lame "Blue Goblin Town". To me this just screams laziness and lack of creativity / imagination on the developers part.

Also I'm not sure why the update list on your game is always such an eye-sore to read through, when you post updates you post them in a mixed category instead of bunching them up. 

MAPS
Ex: 
Fix
Change
Change

ITEMS

Change
Fix
Map
Added
Fix
Change 
FIx

Coding <------- Do we really need to see what you've actually 'coded' into the game? 
FIX 
MAP
ADD
CHANGE


Another thing I seemed to have noticed, after looking at the news post on the 7th of November which they removed.. they added a lot of 'updates and fixes' into the "BIG UPDATE" that they had already done in previous updates.


Tl;dr - Play it for fun, but I wouldn't recommend spending money on it as it is just one of those games that will go no where, the developers aren't even real developers just people that know how to redirect config files and map similar to Endlessonline's Eoserv/Eosource.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080240110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1563563961}
review:
I [b]RECOMMEND[/b] this game for everyone who enjoys those relaxing RPG oldschool MMO styled games. This game has a wonderful community that is very helpful too! No matter what time you get online, there is almost alway someone there in Global chat that could assist you with knowledge about the game. There are currently 14 Skills, (5 combat, 9 non-combat.) This game is never left with a bug unpatched for a long time. Developers are consistant, friendly, and you could connect to them very easily. (WHICH MAKES A GREAT GAME!) [b]It also has a WORKING WIKIA, AND ACTIVE DISCORD![/b]

[b]Some Pros about this game include:[/b]
[list][*]Very Friendly Community
[*]Friendly Staff
[*]Amazing Developers
[*]A Working Wikia
[*]An Active Discord
[*]Basic Skilling/Grinding Style
[*]Old School style feeling
[*]Consistant patching of Bugs and Updates
[*]Hundreds of hours of content.
[*]Non-Toxic Community
[*]PVP Server coming soon!
[/list]
[b]Very few Cons about the game, which are:[/b]
[list][*]Bugs here and there (First Developer's Game)
[*]Micro Transactions, (Mainly Cosmetics) {Used to Support the Developer}
[*]Grinding, however that is a preference.
[/list]

So if you're reading this review on weather you should get the game or not, then you should get it. It is a really great, fun, and enjoyable game and the Orake 2D MMORPG Community is not toxic at all!

[i]Keep in mind the Micro-Transactions are used to help support the servers avalible, and not in any way does it provide an advantage over other players![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198328172798', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13528, 'last_played': 1591792402}
review:
Hai there!
Are you searching endless hours for a new MMORPG? Are you a fan of the old-school, nostalgic feeling of a 2D graphic?
If the answer to those are positive , then you my friend have just arrived at the perfect place!
May the endless searching stop! Now have a moment to read this review!

So after spending quite a bunch of hours in this game I figured I'd like to throw in a review.
At first glance , you gotta like the 2D.. It somewhat feels strange at first , but you gotta give it a shot.
You're not a true RPG player if you quit at first 2 hours - that's def not what RPG is about.
I wud say that you atleast try the game untill level 30 untill you realy felt and seen everything and then you know,
If this game is for you or not.

So after a couple of hours you'll notice that there's a bunch of friendly people that'll help you out.
Almost everytime you got a question there's someone to help or answer it for you.

There's tons of stuff to explore in this game and here comes a list.

Pros --
Quite a big world - takes quite a while to get to end game.
Tons of stuff to do if you ain't into combat at that specific moment. As in crafting proffessions!
Realy, realy friendly community that helps out in almost every case. In case you just want to chat and learn more.
Realy active dev's - there's updates constantly - more like each and every week.

Cons --
I guess con's would be when you die in Boneyard which is a place you can choose not to go to if you dont want to.
It's the place where people PVP.
Restriction to PVP - must be +- 10 Levels of your level in order to attack or be attacked.
When you die over there - you lose almost everything and it sucks a bunch..
But fear not , there's always someone that will get you back on track if you just ask nicely.
Atleast untill you get atleast level 40+ people will almost always be able to set you back on track.
So it's a place you I recommend you visit either way , due to some good leveling.

Other than that I can't realy find another con - yeah it might get slow to level at some point,
Buuuut... It's a RPG - what did you expect.

With some closing words - I do strongly recommend this game - if you into 2D RPG.
Best wishes!
Hope to see you in-game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056198102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3294, 'last_played': 1513334625}
review:
This is a simple and pure MMORPG with a helpful and friendly community.It is grind-heavy and that is to be expected for something of its nature.It has subtle nods to other games that increase the nostalgia you feel from playing it. I have not found any deal breakers yet and I know the game will continue to develop for the players.

EDIT: This part of the review is the experience since I've come back to the game. The developers have clearly been putting time into updates and the meta-game is still wonderful. The recent updates have been a great addition to the game. The music is tasteful, suiting, and professional.  The minigames are fun and keep the morale high for players who need a break from the grind. I strongly recommend giving this game a chance if you love MMORPG's or games like Old School Runescape, Diablo 2, Tibia, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961855349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 45454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43243, 'last_played': 1584473571}
review:
As a veteran of old-style rpg's for almost 15 years now, i love this game. It's got the good elements of games like Runescape and Tibia without the countless botters and hackers. And with plenty of room to grow.

A ton of quests and new stuff being added/tweaked on a weekly basis, new content constantly in the works which in turns makes you excited to log on every day because you never know what might have been added.

Pay2win is pretty much nonexistant with a really juicy teleport room and lots more storage space for those who want the perks of membership, and i'm sure there's alot of additions in store for members aswell.

Varied and interesting enough that the grinding doesn't get old right away, lack of a class system gives you alot of freedom to play the style YOU want to play.

And last but not least... The owner actually gets involved in the community and plays his own game. This is something that i've not seen before or even heard of in ANY game!

So all in all, i recommend this game like i'd recommend a giant, fluffy moist chocolate muffin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352803359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8968, 'last_played': 1533522266}
review:
If you've ever played Runescape or if you enjoy games like it, enjoy old school graffix and gameplay, enjoy a ton of content as well as new new content being added frequently then this game's for you! If you appreciate an incredibly helpful chat community that are willing to answer your questions and help you out in any way they can then you will really enjoy this game! There are always people that are willing to hear and answer your questions, take you to certain areas that you need to find and eventually make you part of their guild! If you ever come across me, I love helping other players, especially the newer ones that don`t have a clue what to do yet or need some extra gold to get them started or even items!!!
For the couple of people that are talking about the developer (adam) and crew not doing any fixes - he has done many different fixes regarding bugs and he`s answered a ton of other queries that people have! I think he`s doing a great job! The game has undergone several updates trying to make it just right for the many different players! 
I have played many different games but this game I have to say one of my favorites! I really recommend this game! I mean it`s FREE!!!!!! What do you have to lose??? Click that Play Now button and see!!!!

Игра требует регистрации логина на сайте, заходишь на сайт, нажимаешь регистрация логина и все, страничка зависает. А, раз нет логина, то и в игру не зайдешь и не поиграешь.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984636266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 7219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7205, 'last_played': 1517615607}
review:
If your into crafting games this ones a gem, other then its a full rpg with no construction thus far, the devs are active in the community, do daily balance tweaks getting it in shape more and more, no limit except a few zones which are strictly for convience over any gear etc you couldnt get f2p. All skills are f2p, no inventory restrictions!! Donating and becoming a subcription based (extremely cheap atm for life time! i would purchase if i had the spare cash atm). adds more pages rather then f2ps get 12 or so cut off etc. The devs wanna do it right, and so far they are, definitely worth your time if you've enjoyed games among the lines of terraria, star dew valley, hell i'd even go as far as to say early diablo fans would like it. If your into the graphics scheme, you'll notice they polished things quite well, spells are brilliantly vibrant, sprites are well done etc. You couldnt get a better f2p on the market for its genre atm. bar none

*edit* if your a cover judger, check the hours of the reviewers and tell me its not worth at the very least, sampling..

-IGN MortySanchez          (morty smith is dead)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084577486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7252, 'last_played': 1506789709}
review:
Orake is a fun game to play.  I would say ~75-100 hours is a good estimate of pure enjoyment with no MTX.  At that point you will start asking yourself a lot of questions.  What can you do about it?  Not a whole lot.  The wiki is very out of date and incomplete.

When I first started I had to make maps on paper of each zone, write down drops from mobs that weren't on wiki and many other things.  I also don't know what the quest line is so I have no clue which NPC I need to advance to the next zone.  The sense of exploration really isn't there.  The quests are "Go kill X-monsters."  "Go collect X-things."  It isn't like we're "finding" something interesting.  The game is just overly tedious in terms of lack of documentation.

The developers are too focused on churning out content rather than refining what already exists.  They focus on that as a priority over properly documenting content so people know how to interact with it.  I'm not sure that is wise since the community is so small.  New players won't have any clue what is available in game... there is little-to-no info on it.  As a result you have to spend extra time gathering information about the game.  Personally I have too many other games that don't hassle players with their "grand ideas of the future" rather than making what exists as pleasant to play as possible.  This is not worth it and I don't see good things for the future for this company w/ this mentality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054667067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1501877879}
review:
Pros:

This game looks really nice!  It has that old school vibe to it with skills and combat and the maps, plus there's a player maintained wikia that's always up to date.  The devs interact with the players all the time and the community is pretty solid and always active, even when the servers crash people still find ways to have fun.

Cons:

It's a grind...all of it...a grind for skills, a grind for materials for crafting, a grind to level up crafting, a grind to level combat skills, and the prices of items sold by NPCs is just insane....you will literally have to grind for days or weeks just to afford high level spells and/or gear and that's not counting the time it takes to grind up the required skills to wear said gear and/or use said spells.  It's a game about grinding.  It's a game about doing the same thing over and over and over again non-stop so you can get a few rewards that help you to do it faster on a different set of mobs and for a different set of items.

This game is a grind, so if you love grinding, you will love this game.  Otherwise, I can't see any normal player lasting more than a few hours in this as a nice diversion.  The servers crash every so often and there have been rollbacks but that's because of the small dev group size and the limited funds.  The game has spirit but because it's been around for about a year, the players that learned how to farm stuff....where to farm stuff....have completely destroyed the value of all in game items.  They found ways to make lots of gold quickly and the devs over adjusted the prices of items to compensate for that....probably not realizing that they were leaving the lower level folks who don't know how to get that much gold that quickly in the dust and facing a rather large mountain to climb to even get anywhere.

I wouldn't reccomend this game because after years spent playing MMOs, I am sick to death of grinding....period.

review:
Выпрашивал у тренера стрелы для увлекательного расстрела овец ради мяса, которое жарил и продавал дабы купить колечко "archery +1" =) 

По первым впечатлениям игрушка вобрала в себя лучшее из игрушек старой школы. 
Есть донат влияющий на геймплей. Подписка на год стоит жалких 24 бакса, она анлочит дополнительные области, боссов и еще всякое по мелочи. Можно купить бонусы к получаемой экспе. И конечно же скины.

Давно искал нечто подобное, вот именно такое, а не всякие альбионы или жалкие браузерные поделки.
Разработчикам респект!
ностальгия 10/10

review: Kdo má rád staré dobré 2D MMORPG bez zbytečné omáčky kolem, je na správném místě. Rozhodně bych vyzdvihl systém levelingu, kdy se musíte zlepšovat ve všech dostupných (Nebo alespoň ve většině) skillů, aby jste dosáhli vyšší úrovně. Rovněž bych pozdvihl chování místní komunity, která vždy pomůže když je třeba. Ve hře navíc můžete být naprosto soběstační co se týče cashflow.Začátečník jako já nepotřebuje žádný support, vše jde tak nějak samo a zábavně.

review: Jogão! Usa diversas características do RuneScape e relembra a época do OldSchool. Quem jogou RuneScape antigamente e joga Orake sente a nostalgia. Único problema é que o jogo não tem bastante players, acho que deveriam investir no marketing do jogo, porque é um ótimo MMORPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336277655', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1501476352}
review:
Having spent a good few minutes chasing rats about in some toffs back yard, I set off to seek my fame and fortune in the word of Orake...!

What dangers awaited me? I wondered, as I made my way through town. I spotted what I took to be a weapnsmiths of some kind. And entered to see if I couldnt equip myself for battle. The weaponsmith didn't have much on sale. But an impressive looking suit of armour caught my eye.

''How much?'' I asked.

''Fifty two billion trillion gold coins'' He replied... 

I decided to stick with just my bronze sword for the moment. At least until I happened upon the wreck of a Spanish galleon washed up on the shore on a return journey from the new world.

The town seemed to be well guarded. I stopped to ask directions from one of the heavily armed knights patrolling the streets. Unfortunatly, I have a disability that means I begin conversations in the exact same way as I violently attack someone. Understandably, the knight was not best pleased. I decided to make myself scarce...

Sometime later, and I came upon a farmer by the roadside. Calling me over, he explained that he had way too many cows, and could I thin them out a bit for him? I told him he needed the services of a butcher. Not a dashing young adventurer out to seek his fame and fortune!

Passing by the various other riff-raff who were all busy slaughtering cows and sheep and chickens and whatnot, I took the road that led out of town. And it wasnt long before I spied a large hole in the ground with a ladder that led down into the darkness below.

My first dungeon! 

Gripping the hilt of my sword, I headed towards it. Only to find my way blocked by a bee. It was a level eighteen bee, but seeing as the local cows and sheep and chickens and suchlike we all level eight or thereabouts, I reckoned I should be able to take on a bee.

I was wrong. I died from multiple stings.

The End.

review: As you can see ive got nearly 90 hours played in the past 2 weeks. This game is great! There are some rough edges that you will get used to. If you can look past a few short comings and level up some the game opens up alot and becomes alot more than it seems on the surface. author: {'steamid': '76561198031442540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1931, 'last_played': 1502674871}
review:
Raeas is a good lad, a good lad indeed if in doubt just send a shout to RAEAS (only R capitalized)

Now to the biz my bois,
This game has value, It will gain even more as more money flows as like all games.
Things I like (I LIKE NOT U ITS MY OPINON!)

-has lots of things relevate to other online games like it (RS, and other that faded) but... drumroll its free and has lots to offer like:inventory space (gen ammount), crafting (anything), Spells!!! free to cast and they level how nice!, KK I wont digress more you will just need to dig in.

-Has teleport spells at a resonable price from vendor

-Has a big pvp area that has nessary quests and crafting to be done, thus forcing people to visit for gain, which causes massive guild wars later iam sure hahahahHAHAHAHAHAAHAH!!!

-Bosses with different forms and different requirements to defeat!

-You can kite bosses and enemies due to LOS (line of sight) spells or distance hahah! you can sprint away.

-Has lots of potential and a great time burner that will always pay out with happy friends and guildies if u help them lol

OKAY... nuff of that boosting the game reviews etc, time to tear this baby down!!!!!
Things I dont like (ONCE AGAIN NUB MY OPINION)

-Devs reset the server wayyyy too quick like 30s and gtfo which is understandable if they say on such and such day we will conduct a reset etc (at there defense they probably have a small team working on the game so they cant do this I think...)

-Lots of rules to get you banned easily if some can persaude you to fall for it. (I havent been banned but I hear QQ about it all the time from nubs on forums)

-Gliches that are not game breaking yet but they can be if you are farming a hard boss or something rare and it drops and .. BAM! server kick you have to relogg (Good thing there UI is light and game is light any powerful PC like mine bic bois it can spark this BB up in about 20s or less, so hopefully item stays there and I dont die for some odd reason)

-Toxic players: people who report you for being silly, people who cry about the game, people who want more and more form the devs yet they dont want to help spend or give word of the game they SO MUCH love... (every MMORPG has this though so its not bad but... this game is new so it hurts the community imo)

-introduction to the game... LISTEN UP NUBS quick break down
*graveyard is death will drop everything you have (grave yard is the area above starting town)
*spells do not depelete they level up that is what the numbers mean on the spell (example 21/100 cast it 79 more times and it levels)
*token island is a PVP area you dont lose ur items u lose ur tokens u farm so hard for! IM SO HARD BRO SOOOOOOOOOO HARDDD!!
*dont waste your time leveling everything max only work on what u need and progress your characters main attributes ATT, ARCH, SORC, END your welcome nub!
*dont talk trash to people you dont know because at some point you will need help trust me!
*dont ask for money you can easily farm what you need in a matter of minutes and GUESS WAT NUBS? the game is about the grind so get used to it and enjoy and make friends

THATS IT BOIS thanks oh and BTW dont forget to level up ur sailing or you will never ride the BLACK PEARL SHIP hidden in   the deep waters of Davey Jones LOCKERRRR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154994319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1501271575}
review:
This game is great, and there is always something to do. Although it can get very confusing most of the times, all you have to do is ask for help in chat and someone will answer your questions, all the time. The map and the design is very nostalgic  and reminds me of runescape. What I also like is how you are not restricted on one class, but you can train your skills and switch through different classes. There is Attacker, Archer, and Sorcerer. 

Pros:
MMO like runescape
Great community
Lots of things to do
Addicting
Nice map and layout
Creative
Doesn't need a nuclear computer
No classes 
Lots of different Skills

Cons: 
Disconnects sometimes
Controls and combat is not the smoothest
Confusing at the start 
Early development, so not as much features but still enough to keep you playing for 30+ hours and enjoy it.
Can be grindy, but arent all mmos?

I highly suggest this game, as it is free, addicting, entertaining, and does not require quantam computers to run it. Community is also great, everyone is helping eachother. If you are skeptical, atleast try it, you wont regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077231812', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 10541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4351, 'last_played': 1659852543}
review:
Great game. Reminds me of old Tibia memories <3


- Great variety of items and monsters. 

- Soundtrack is great! My favorite is the Land of Ice soundtrack.

- The DEVs are constantly updating the game based on our ideas and suggestions. They fix bugs and glitches very fast.

- You can ask for help at the global chat anytime and someone will always help you. I simply love the community!

Oh, and they have a discord channel, too. It's easier to report a bug or give an idea there.


Keep up the great work! :D

Asdra. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030855861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1554, 'last_played': 1514689546}
review: This game is amazing but it takes a little time to get to the good parts. At the start it just seems like grinding very similar to RS classic and not much else. However once you get past the starting levels and you figure out the quest lines that send you exploring; you start to see how the game, and world just keeps building on itself. From entire towns found deep in frozen caves, tons of interesting monsters, engaging quest, boss battles, magical items only earned from secret locations, and puzzles to explore the world. All this and more is what makes this game great. Making friends in this game makes the tougher quest possible and the community is very welcome. There aare hidden bosses in secret passages, magical crafting, and an incredible areas to explore. What really sets this game apart is spells and skills you can assign to your hotbar for every class. These skills can be upgraded and make the combat a lot more engaing. The PvP games are a ton of fun, with rewarding magical equipment from doing well. The developer is always in game or on discord and he is constantly taking suggestions and adding to the game which I think guarantees this game will be something even more amazing than it already is. Going on monster hunts in the boneyard (which is similar to RS wilderness) is a lot of fun and gives the game purpose. When your skills, and your friends are your best weapons, there's nothing you can't do. Give this game a chance, talk to the community, and get a player to show you the quest around the world before you deicide if this game is for you. I almost dropped it at the start but after a few more hours of gameplay I've been dedicating all my free time to orake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018520356', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 8537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7945, 'last_played': 1504049889}
review:
I used to Recommend this game, but the game kept constantly crashing and the servers have alot of sync issues. Some people keep losing progress because they try to switch servers.

If you like old RS Clasic games go ahead and give it a try, but beware of constant server problems and a shrinking population.

If you like to play an MMORPG but don't always feel like being in a party with random people? this is not the game for you, after a certain level you need to party up with people to kill the bosses and because the bosses are not instanced, there's ussually a group of higher level peoples that have them on farm so good luck with that.

Overall this game could be something great, but as it stands avoid it.

Sort of like a 2d rip off of Runescape, with considerably less content. The only thing to do in this game is mindlessly grind and watch your skill levels slowly go up. There is no real content other than watching your skill levels rise.

Just play clicker heroes if you're thinking of playing this. Or cookie clicker.
developer_response: We have very fun pvp, from what i have been told. We also have a fun mini-game with 2 more comming!! :)

review: The game is alot of fun right from the get go, and it's highly addictive. Definitely bring back those oldschool rpg vibes, i love it! Ofcourse it has alot of room for improvement, but i hope the devs will keep up the good work. The market definitely has room for an mmorpg with tons of content, and i hope this is what the devs will thrive for. Try it out, join the fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039906239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 60656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39776, 'last_played': 1543051332}
review:
Probably the best mmorpg I've ever played. If you've ever wanted a perpetual online experience with beautiful 2D graphics. You have stumbled upon a gem. You can be a melee knight/warrior. or you can grab a bow and become a master marksman in archery! Or you can pick up a magic staff and become a powerful sorcerer. The choice is yours! You can become a master of all! No class restrictions necessary.

Aside from the combat you can level up all sorts of other fun skills, such as cooking, crafting gear, alchemizing magical potions. gathering materials, CHOPPING DOWN TREES. Orakes got it all.

The community is a very wonderful place with a lot of wonderful people whom bless the atomosphere. 

This game is very well made and getting better everyday. developers really care about this beautiful project. RECOMMEND

author: {'steamid': '76561198140936516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1500127047}
review:
El juego en sí, es muy bueno para todos aquellos amantes de los MMORPG al estilo de la vieja escuela, tiene mucho parecido con el Runescape, el unico problema que al ser un juego indie y creo que uno de sus primeros juegos, este tiene DEMASIADOS bugs, y con decir demasiados me refiero a muchos, de hecho el principal problema por el que no he podido jugar tanto es porque tengo un bug en la pantalla de carga, sin embargo el creador siempre trata de solucionarlos y es muy cercano a los jugadores pero obviamente no puede ayudar a toda la comunidad, sin embargo la idea y la originalidad esta muy bien hecha, otra cosa que el juego necesita y son guías, el juego en si tiene una pagina en Wikia (Si no me equivoco) pero sin embargo le falta mucha información y es un problema para poder hacer las quests, el fuerte de este juego es el entrenamiento de habilidades, pero la verdad en este no es molesto como puede a llegar ser en otros porque se sube de nivel mas o menos "rápido", sin embargo con los problemas de la info que le falta al juego la comunidad siempre esta ahí para ayudarte (en inglés).

Sin nada más que decir les digo que deberian darle una oportunidad. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198079901654', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 15830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12816, 'last_played': 1675829808}
review: EXCELLENT classic-type mmo. F2P with a fair and cheap subscription option. Many different skills to level-up and master. Different fighting styles. A plethora of different items. Great leveling formula. This is a must-try Free to play MMO. "They don't make em' like these anymore" is what i said in the first 20 hours. The devs are extremely active and are always willing to help and answer questions. They also are open to suggestions to new ideas and any ways to improve the game. However they have their own tricks up their sleeves. Many different areas to explore and many places to delve into. Rewarding Boss enemies that are very tough but rewarding. I would rate this game 8.0/10 and if they were to smooth out a few issues that never necesarily affect you playing your game. Great community also. If you have not downloaded this game to try i don't honestly know what you're waiting for. Good Luck.

игра написана на VBA xD

ужасный интерфейс
почему-то нет автоатаки, что странно для такого рода игры

author: {'steamid': '76561198314324024', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1502917737}
review:
Un jeu très spécial, aitant en 2D il fait de lui un jeu or paire, il ressemble à runescape dans le fait d'augmenter tes statistiques par rapport à tes actions:
-tu tapes avec une épée ---> stats attaque augmenté
-Tu tapes avec un arc ------> stats archerie augmenté 

Il est compliqué à prendre en main , au début de jeu on ne sait pas quoi faire et le jeu est en anglais, mais la communauté est très actif et aident très facilement les nouveaux joueurs , ce qui me pousse à continuer ^^ 
Niveau combat les effets sont basics mais donne le charme de Orake 2D, ne parlont pas des musiques reposantes.

Le plus compliquer au début du jeu c'est de savoir au niveau quel monstre tu peux tuer, ensuite ça va tout seul

Personellement je prend beaucoupde plaisir à jouer avec mes potes j'espere que vous ferez de même.

Cordialement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009715205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1509902018}
review:
I highly rec this game to anyone who wants to take part in a Game that feels like you just started 2002 Runescape. 

Wana be a mage? go for it, Wana be a Rogue? Go for it, wana be a strength pure? Go for it, Wana be a healer? go for it. Wana chill out and FISH?!! go for it. Want to woodcut and create materials threw crafting? Want to be an Alchemist? This game has so many different things to do. WILDERNESS PvP?! HELL YEAH

Anyway, i'll get right down to it. BAM Created a character, walked threw the town a bit, and the Atmosphere was actually pretty nice. Other people were playing , doing their own thing, so I said FuQ it, and adventured off on my own. THAT FEELING of starting 2d Runescape again, was there, and it felt great, still feels great. 

All in all i'm giving this game currently a 7.5/10, and it has the potential to be much higher. 



Cons: Little lag, here and there, but that's normal for new games, while they work out the server Kinks. (Remember, WoW on launch, or Runescape on 2001-2002 launch) 

Pros: Can meet brand new people, adventure, party and get LOOT. 

It also gives you the feeling of being Part Of something bigger than yourself. Like your Opinion about the game, matters, and changes you'd like to see, matters to the Developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184854325', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1697996788}
review: Honestly this game is addicting. The small community makes it friendly and they've got a pretty helpful wiki for everything. Quite a bit of bugs but this game has only been out a year from what i've heard, so I understand. I'd recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a bit of nostalgia. I know the devs are had at work with this one and I can't wait to see where it goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047919319', 'num_games_owned': 3, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1498168181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198394504534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1499358071}
review: No great game has started out perfect. On a search for my new mmo after givng up runescape and warframe,I stumbled across this little gem in the rough. The first thing you need to do,if you're looking for a new good gaming community to get involved with,is give this game a try. After you soak in the nostalgia and get used to the controls,and explore everything available to you,level up your skills,team up with a guild and slay some bosses,get to know this up-coming fantasy world not for what it is,but for what it could and will be- with a classic rpg loving community supporting it. You have a chance to be a part of newborn throwback rpg world, a time when each bit of help with development counts. Overall,even in it's brandnew stage,it's a great game.
