author: {'steamid': '76561198072622976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1584997490}
review: Dont get me wrong this game is certainly still rough around the edges and doesnt offer much depth right now but the devolopers and admins are very active and improving the game every day. Most of the things people are complaining about are just things there working to improve and fix. They just opened another server and improved server speeds to help lag they fixed the random kickings and are adding more content to the game. The best thing by far I would have to say though is the comunity. With no real wiki or how to guides all the help you really have is asking other people in chat and with a very active and lively community they always are super nice and helpful. If you want a polished 2d mmo then maybe not your deal here but if you really believe in the future of this game then id atleast try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092462240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1497902066}
review: Played for a couple hours. Was a fun little game but got bored quickly and just started wandering around the world seeing what I could find. It heavily relies on grinding right now so while that is fine for leveling up, I want a reason to level up. I couldn't find places to buy higher level gear and crafting wasn't interesting since you can only craft things to help you fight to help you level up. I NEED options!! Like different types of attacks or different skills. Otherwise, why should I grind or why should I save up money if there is nothing to buy but better gear? So though this game was interesting, it still has a ways to go before it is an actual game worth playing for more than a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035971640', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1503201618}
review:
If you're looking for a classic fun RPG with a budding community, Orake 2D is for you.

The community's just getting started. That means the players arent just googling guides and min/maxing right from the start. Everyone's learning and discovering at an equal level, and there's tons of older players who are happy to help newbies.

If the idea of getting in early to an RPG isn't enticing to you, Orake doesn't have a lot more to offer in my eyes. But the small community and lack of everything being "figure out" already is really fun to me.

Hopefully as updates roll out Orake 2D will hold up over the years, but as it stands I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053044814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 27858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12143, 'last_played': 1568568585}
review:
I like the game and you can tell this game is definitely based on RuneScape. The loot system and monster tagging is complete trash though. You can do 99% of the damage and someone can just walk in and steal the kill with 1 last hit and they get the loot. It does get boring quick and you run out of stuff to do fast. The questing is weird, there's a ton of bugs, the game needs a lot of work. It has a lot of potential though. I can see this beeing a very good and widely played game but only after they fix A LOT.

Edit: 7/17/2017 Near higher level it's an endless grind. If you like spending LITERALLY hundreds of hours grinding for the next upgrade, then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123057373', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1848, 'last_played': 1530427800}
review:
*-------------------------UPDATE--------------------------------*

I happen to find this game again on the store and started thinking about my experience well playing the game. The content in the old review was from about 1-3 hours of gameplay and it was already very grindy, but I was okay with that. I remember this one time in chat when I was comparaing this game to osrs. Because lets be honest its an attempted at grabbing success from an amazing game like osrs. If you don't believe me play the game for 15 minutes and try to tell me otherwise. Anyways I was making some constructive critizism as to how the leveling system worked and the one of the devs started moaning and crying about how this game isn't osrs and don't you ever compare the two. Long story short this game really did have potential, however the devs are petty and only want people to play their game if they agree to everything they're saying.



*-------------------------OLD REVIEW----------------------------*

Very awesome and nostalgic if you like really old school runescape as the game is heavily influnced by runescape. The only real big downsides to this game is that theres no real direction to be pointed towards and quests don't give much information, however I personally like this. The other thing is the servers. I don't think the develpers expected so many players to download the game so it makes the servers decently laggy as well as an un responsive login button that doesn't tell you when the servers are you down, you just have to guess. Other than that the game is amazing and really brings in a runescape like experience.

review: now i may have only played about 10 mins of this trash "game" but 10 mins is long enough to make me ashamed to play video games. you spawn into this locked area filled like 30 other players and like 3 rats that respawn every hour. i played for about 10 mins and got no indication of how to exit the room. you also spawn with some weapons and a spell. do you get any indication that you have said weapons and spell. hell no. it took me 6-7 mins to even find out i have them. i threw down my sword by accident and due to the game being the equivalent of the annoying ass paperclip helper that no one likes, it didnt tell me how to pick it back up. so i was walking around a locked room with clunkey controls and ugly graphics trying to fist a rat. 0/10 dont play if you want your sanity

author: {'steamid': '76561198239144702', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1497754847}
review: The controls are extremely unresponsive, The "attack" button just makes you look like a fool even if you have a weapon equiped, The level 1 rats do more damage than you do and are likely to kill you before you ever figure out what button makes your extremely unresposive charicter use their weapon, Dont bother with ranged attacks because you still have to stand right next to them to even have a hope of attempting to hit any enemy, The only way to get more beginning enemies to fight is to wait 24 hours for the server to reset, To top it all off when you click to close the game it brings up a menu that can comepletely freeze your game for up to 5 minutes just so you can confirm that you want to close the game

author: {'steamid': '76561197992999976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16395, 'last_played': 1498977765}
review:
I have deleted my original review which was optimistic, and believed in the development's team. Written a few weeks ago prior to the full release of Orake, the game had it's bugs; which I understand were being worked on, but the game should have never been launched until it was stable. 

At it's current state:
[list]
[*]Server's are up and down, or being manaully taken down by the Development team for "patch" jobs. 
[*] Quest log is a chore to utilize, and is all but useless.
[*] There is not nearly enough content to keep a player "wanting" more initially other than to see their skills increase in level. (I understand the open-world concept, but there is nearly no story behind the world, no reason to play other than to kill a few monsters and increase your non-combat skill levels so you can wear "X" gear or cook/craft/alchemize "X" item.
[*] The game itself does not have a concrete road map, and the main developer is constantly fighitng issues w/ the server's and other core features of the game that are not functioning properly.
[*] The online store (no steam store integrated as of yet) has to be manually given to each individual who makes a purchase and this will only get more and more confusing as new players come to Orake and the lead developer is having to manually add memberships/premium coins to those accounts.
[*] Evidently they are rewriting the game's base programming language from VB6 to C++. Which I can understand the change, but that should have been completed in an Alpha version of the game, not the final 'release'; which this game is currently slated as. It is my opinion that it hasn't even reached a level to warrant it the badge of beta testing as of yet.[/list]

I still believe Orake has the ability to become a great game, but there needs to be some general changes made:

[list]
[*]A concrete Road Map / Goals system needs to be implemented by the development team.
[*] A proper bug tracking / development life cycle from the programming team.
[*] TEAM - the lead developer needs to deligate and properly manage a team of programmers / community managers / game PR managers.
   [list][*] The lead developer should allow anyone else from those that are available to handle Orake's public relations, as his abrasive and nonchalant attitude tend to run quite a few people away from the game.[/list][/list]

I will continue to play Orake, but I am not as completely optimistic in it's future as I once was. Once things have leveled out some and the lead developer puts a proper business model into action I will update my review, but for now I can't in good faith recommend this game to others.

review: Orake 2D MMORPG, it seems a little rough but all in all a decent way to relive some of the classic MMO experience. I don't know how it will turn out population wise, but if you are interested recommend you check it out.

review: I am really enjoying the game. It is slow to get started but the Gm and his crew do their best to keep up on bugs and problems. Orake is still in its alfa form and has much to offer im sure in the future. I look forward to see how it turns out. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198132198445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11754, 'last_played': 1563723029}
review: So much potential. Few bugs, that's to be expected. Its a brand new game, with different features than other mmorpgs. The staff team literally is working day and night to improve the servers, and cross over to another system for coding with it. New content is being released, and updates to keep things fair. I've noticed a bunch of childish comments on the positive reviews. Please stop wasting your time trying to prevent other people from at least giving Orake a try. As for those of you scrolling through the comments, trying to determine if this is worth a shot- only you can decide that for yourself. But I do ask you don't listen to both the positives, or the negatives, and just go see for yourself why I am suggesting you at least give it a shot for yourself. Who knows, you might enjoy it. I'll warn you. There is lag, there's unfinished content, and there's tons of bugs. But the coding team is working to fix that. Please bare with them as they do, as they are trying fairly hard. Thanks for understanding. If you are lagging excessively, try switching to server 2 or 3. There's little to no lag there. Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203961431', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 1356, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1495781292}
review:
Для запуска этой игры требуется сторонняя программа.
Как и во всех ММОRPG, нет графики и хорошенькой музыки,а хотя нет, полно таких MMORPG.
Задания показались мне скучными, ну или я слишком весел жизнью.
Отойти на несколько минуточек не получится, игра просто выкинет вас из мира.
Обучения нет(ну да да, вроде все должно быть самому понятно, но видимо, я-умственно отсталый индивид).
Багов чуток.
Единственный плюс,который я заметил- это разнообразие контента.
Но меня не затянуло.
(Можете пиздеть внизу, что я- абычный каэсер каторый ваабще ток в каэс еграет а любая не каэс эта дирьмо)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Это, игра не заброшена и разрабы пытаются общаться с массой, которая играет в их проект и это не может не радовать, игра определенно имеет будущее, если не забросят и добавят чуток разнообразия в задания.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981544474', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5176, 'last_played': 1503598790}
review:
I've played this game for long enough to know it has a lot of potential. 
Devs have been great, community is very helpful and friendly. 
If you like the classic MMORPG style mixed with new MMO's features, with lots more to come you should come play. The game has been out for quite a while and a lot has changed, and it is being worked on daily.  

The controls can be tricky but are very easy to use, either WASD and F/ctrl to interact/attack, or arrow keys. 
Helpful beginner quests, and other chain quests.
Very fun and interactive professions you can choose to level up whenever.

This game is still in Early Access so obviously a lot of things need work but it is very playable, so if you understand this, I'm sure you'll have fun playing it while the game grows.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054213929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1495086114}
review:
I played this game before it came out on steam and had the opportunity to speak directly with the lead developer. Although the game has charm and will give anyone who has played Runescape nostalgia, you will quickly run out of things to do and realize the game's problems. This mostly the fault of the main developer and his incompetence. Being a newly created game, there are a plethora of bugs and glitches, even problems that sometimes cause the whole server to crash. While very frustrating, this is expected and should, I hope, go away with time as long as people continue to work on the game.

Some of the major issues:

If a mob spawns on the same square a player is on, that player and the mob is trapped there until another player comes by and kills the mob. This can even happen in the wilderness (which functions exactly like the Runescape version), and could easily let other players set up to kill them.

The combat styles are totally imbalanced in pvp. Archery is by far the strongest combat style due to being able to infinitely kite players while firing arrows. Magic spells have too long cast times and too short cast distances so that players can simply run away if they see someone start to channel a spell. Melee is by far the worst because both the person attacking and person being attacked have to remain TOTALLY STILL for attacks to land. This means you can just run around if someone is trying to melee you and avoid everything.

There simply is not enough content at this point for the game to be interesting for an extended period of time. If you party with other players to get group xp you will be able to kill the strongest monsters in the game in the matter of a few days. At this point, it's not even worth trying to kill other players because the only reliable way is to exploit bad mechanics.

Duplication glitch. I know of one duplication glitch in this game. There are probably more...

If any of these mechanics get fixed I'll remove them from this review.

Finally, lets talk about ResBak Online. If you've played Orake, you've probably had your game crash at some point and might have seen the message "ResBak Online has stopped responding." A quick Google search will reveal another 2D MMO project that failed. The server and client for ResBak is available Online and after playing it, is IDENTICAL to Orake.

http://imgur.com/e0mVmTS

Literally the only difference are the sprites used. The source code for ResBak is available online for $30 is very obviously how the developer was able to produce Orake without knowing anything about or understanding his "own" game. The best part is that the main developer I referred to earlier explicitly stated "I created 99% of the content in this game.".....

author: {'steamid': '76561198069670837', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3579, 'last_played': 1502989680}
review:
Welcome to another one of Potisiums Reviews! Today i am reviewing "Orake 2D MMORPG"
Where to start?! OH i know! 
This game is very fu8cking  good...  while it may be still in development stage it has active players to test the new content and to help you out. At first i did not understand this game but once i got it down it was a peice of cake! The dev team is not only active but extremley helpful. They do have a few bugs but they get them fixed ASAP. 

While it may not look appealing to the young people of Steam To the people who were around during the Early MMORPG era this game will be a dream for you. It just added A pvp realm/server Last night i have not tried this realm yet i am content in my Pve. But if you are into pvp i would say give the pvp realm a go you may enjoy the pvp server. hours of training and questing and a few bosses to fight!

Do not be confused by the level of mobs this really doesn't matter. i am level 17 fighting level 30 mobs. The community itself is pretty friendly. but there is always that one person who is a total a$s Wipe. thankfully though i have not came across them yet. So if you do want a 2D MMORPG that is good and fun Plus free. This is probably the game you will want to try!


Do i suggest this game??? HELL YES!!!!

Thats it for this review I hope to see you On my next review until then! Tah tah!

author: {'steamid': '76561198260575254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6120, 'last_played': 1495954992}
review:
Edit; Most of the bad reviews are shitty internet trolls, so just ignore the retarded reviews and try this game out. 

Let me start off by saying this game has alot of potential. It's a 2D MMORPG with good features and surprisingly addictive progression. 

If you like variety, no-class specific accounts, oldschool graphics and OSRS type combat then this is the game for you. With a selection of skills to train such as fishing, cooking, woodcutting etc, the game isn't purely combat orientated. This isn't a game for a quick hit, it will require many hours to progress but that's the beauty of it. 

A small community of dedicated and active players makes for a solid experience every time you log in. Staff are active, experienced and keen to grow the server. 

Now don't get me wrong, this game does have its flaws (as all games do) but the dev team is quick to assure us these are all being taken care of and they listen to the community. I recommend giving this game a shot and if it's not for you then so be it.

review: Takes some getting used to as it's very straight forward. Could use a little stream lining, like not having to drag and drop materials onto a furnace/anvil/etc. If it could detect which station you're next to when you double click a Material (not equipment), it should recognize that you want to craft. Just my thought. Otherwise it's a good 2d game. Takes some work. A Quick Help section would be great. A list of basic Key press commands like "C" opens Character and so on. Along with some helpful beginner tips for new players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347285445', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1537542396}
review:
チュートリアルが終わればあとは作業の連続。
一例、
：剣・杖・弓レベルを上げるため、まずは牧場の牛と羊と鳥狩り。序盤でまともに戦えるのがこれぐらいしかいない。
：魔法は気が遠くなるほど何度も魔法を使って魔法レベルを上げていい魔法を買う。何度も同じ魔法使うと使い飽きてくる。
：爪付グローブを装備して何度もキー押して果実を取り、錬金釜に空ビンを置いて果実を材料に薬を作成。もっといい薬を作りたければこれを繰り返して錬金レベルを上げる。果実採集レベルアップのおまけつき。
：洞窟へ行き、ツルハシを装備して何度もキー押して鉱石を取り、町へ戻って釜に鉱石を置いて鉱石を材料にインゴットを作成、そしてそのインゴットや木など素材を材料に装備やアイテムを作っていく。もっといい装備アイテムを作りたければこれを繰り返して鍛冶関連のレベルを上げる。採掘・伐採レベルアップのおまけつき。
：釣竿を装備して何度もキー押して魚を釣り、焚き火に魚を置いて焼き魚を作る。もっといい料理を作りたければこれを繰り返して調理レベルを上げる。釣りレベルアップのおまけつき。
このような作業の連続はもううんざり。しかも作業で上げられるレベルの経験値は確認できるとして、キャラのレベルの経験値は確認もできない。しかもクエスト関連も受注可能レベルや場所が分かりにくい、クエストも不十分でさらに上記作業に陥るクエストもあり、このゲームには退屈しかない。配信されるまで代替で遊んでた2DRPGの方がまだ退屈もしない。

なお、課金コンテンツがあるが、ゲーム内では購入できず、公式サイトから購入する形式。表記はドルのみ対応。

author: {'steamid': '76561198120351579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 48739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19574, 'last_played': 1633289037}
review:
(Im going to preference this with) Okay, where to start, as of now this game is not good nor bad but right in the middle. Orake in my eyes still needs a lot of work, its not a perfect gae by any means, but it has a lot of potential. The owner of this game is very commited (even though some times i do question how commited) to making this game and has put a lot of work into. 

Skills - (Pro) The skills are very self explanatory, the main combat ones are Melee - Range - Mage.
            Every life skill is unique in its own way and is useful, no life skill is useless.

            (Con) Although every life skill is used for something of some importance the exp rate and the ways of getting
            need some work.

PvP - (Pro) Honestly i really have nothing bad to say about pvp, its full loot and multi (10 people can attack one person) how the pvp is setup it really flows well with the game, you can only attack players that are 10 levels higher then you or 10 levels lower then you, so its balanced to some extent.

Staff - (Pro) Theirs really only one "staff" member and thats the GM, it can be a bad thing at times because he cant be on 24/7 but becasue its closed beta and the community is small it works. For the most part adam (The GM) listens to the community and takes suggestions from them.

(Con) - Adam is not a coder, meaning he needs to rely on someone else to add big changes and fix some bugs, as of right now this is fine but later on i could see it being a big problem.

To sum all this up, i have ~300hours in this game and still feel no need to stop. The grind for gear is always available because no one, not even the best of the best have anywhere close to the best gear in the game. The community can be a little toxic at times but is fine 90% of the time, they always help out people who are new and give tips.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150340873', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12478, 'last_played': 1492527804}
review:
After putting in almost 200 hours into this game, my impression has sunk into a new low. At first, it was a great game to kill time whenever you had it and a chance to build your charatcer in more ways than just mindless combat. From being a melee tank to a greedy merchant, you pretty much can do what you like in this open world type game and develop the skills you like on a day to day purpose. In other words, you make the story of your adventure.

Now the controls aren't the best in the world, being that the same button to melee is the same button to also interact (causing many issues when you need to access a door or a chest). Also, the npcs move quite a bit to the point where you need to play cat and mouse to interact with them. There's also no targeting monsters in this game, but you can target players for the purposes of pvp (which I think this is where the game is heading towards.). That's not all to the controls of course, but I believe those two points make it quite clear that there needs to be some thought put in if this game hopes to make it past early access and towards open beta.

Graphics wise I like the simplicity this game has because it feels like a game, and not a grueling chore or obligation. Unique animations with spells and unique monsters which leaves room to think back into the past when you played your first mmo. Also the soundtrack of this game are borrowed melodies from other games, but again adds to the nostalgia factor.

As for the community, there couldn't be a better one. Quite a dynamic and helpful community that welcomes all kinds of players, and makes you feel right at home. Admins are quite vigilant and will assist you in more ways than one. Surely there are some sore spots, but usually comes to a halt when it comes to helping a new player or someone asking a question.

Finally, the gameplay of his game is again (and sorry for repeating this word constantly) nostalgic. You fight enemies, level your combat accordingly, and proceed to the next step. Skills like mining or gathering as of a similar fashion, requiring lots of patience in order to make the gold necessary for purchasing spells or armor.

Now you maybe asking, why I feel a new low with this game after all the praise? Well, it comes to the instability of where the game stand. Gold wipes have been happening quite often, and lots of disconnecting issues and running the game. There seems to be a lot more bugs than what the devs and admin are overseeing, and with the current higher leveled players demanding for content they neglect to see the bigger picture. Sure everyone wants new content and want access to new maps and features, but those players make up the minority of what is to come with the influx of new players coming in. The principle of the matter is making the server stable enough to where the servers are running at a constant pace, and the need for maintenance is limited to at least once a week. Constant changing, wiping and having the server down can bring lack of trust to players, and the competency of the admins who run this game. Also, the controls need tweaking big time and mods need to moderate come of the potential issues that the community can fester up through frustration and inpatience, and the assistance of new players to catch up. Only then will the game grow and improve with a wider range of support and ideas. 

Other than that, this game on my end receives a 7/10. Not quite there yet, but I am hoping and I do recommend this game despite the negatives I have pointed out.

.P.S. For the love of Orake, stop encouraging people to use discord and adding features through that venue. Instead, implement a mail system so the players can reach out to you efficiently, giving you the time to view them at your pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070918070', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1500593706}
review:
I've played this game for about a week, I love the concept, I love these types of games. I could see this game going places. But, I'm afraid I can't say I'm going to continue with the game. There's a small community that plays, and I feel that the reason for that, is that it's all multi combat. So, if you're a new beginner like me, you could be working your butt off to PVE, and some higher level could just come by and last hit the monster and take your kill/loot; or they will just sit by you and wait til you almost kill the monster, and they will just last hit it with their high magic level (that I doubt they got legitly). One thing i've noticed, is that the higher levels in this game, will intentionally grief you. They are a bunch of man children playing the game, and will get salty literally over anything, even if you give suggestions on how they could help the game grow. Another thing that I've noticed, is that the MODs don't seem to care about the community as a whole; they only care about what the higher levels think, and ONLY cater to the higher levels. Good luck to anyone who decides to try this game. You might as well just go play Runescape, their Devs and MODs actually care about the communities opinions and suggestions.

End rant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010344246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6616, 'last_played': 1489529928}
review:
The game as it stands is pretty terrible, in summation it aims to emulate runescape classic. Aesthetically the poorly intergrated GUI is somewhat reminiscent of RS's but as for everything else (characters, enviroments & items), or the majority to say the least are all ripped and horribly implemented assets from other games (doom, WoW, multitudes of RPG Maker project resources) currently as placeholders, or i hope they're placeholders , I'll give them benefit of the doubt on this.

There are three combat skills: attack, sorcery & ranged. each one with what seems to use different XP modifiers (leveling at a faster rate than others) and endurance, these constitute your overall level, which is determined by by the aformentioned skills. Atk/sorc/ranged are 8 for each overall level determined and endurance is 2 for each overall lv gained. crafting skills have no affect on your overall level, they are barely worth mentioning aside from from being time sinks and requirements for accessing certain areas with little to no relevance, as it stands with current playerbase and structure they're negligable for trade.

If you do happen to stay for a prolonged visit you will find that 90% of actual gameplay consist of holding down the CTRL key while standing in front of either a Monster spawn or a gathering node, you're better off sinking time into actual idle games, as you'll inevitably be accused or in suspicion of macroing your CTRL key down, the community itself is alright as well as the lead of the project (Adambrosio) albeit he's not the brightest crayon in the box and struggles to handle critisicm rationally , and without naming certain individual(s) on his team, some are downright appalling.

I wish the best for the project and community, but as it stands in no way can i recommend this game in it's current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048890138', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1489878422}
review:
ー・ＢＬＡＣＫＧＵＹ’Ｓ　ＳＰＥＥＤＬＥＶＥＬ　ＧＵＩＤＥ・ー
So I got to lvl 69 in about 30 mins, it's really simple and i'll tell you how in this detailed easy to follow guide.

・Start by naming yourself Blackguy and create your character.
 
・Once you have your character created begin counting down from 100
   (make sure you do this in Global chat for everyone to see).
The Creator of the game will then promptly begin to beg you not to crash the server and accuse you of being someone named either Sky or Benjo.

・At this point just ignore it and demand alterations to all of your stats, ask for all of your parameters to be raised to LV. 69.
The Creator will lack sufficient intellect to understand the proper course of action to take in this situation and give into your demands. 
You will be transported to a small room absent of players and witnesses that exist outside of the playable area. 
The Creator will promptly beg you (with salty tears streaming down his face) to cease all actions pertaining to crashing the server.

・This is when you agree to the terms set by him. After that he will ask you to walk forward and you will be awarded by having all of your parameters altered to 69.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         -2/10 game 2 EZ

Proof: http://imgur.com/a/weaJD

Ps. they will say you are a hacker even though you really aren't and have no idea how to do anything to the game
developer_response: The game was going to be shut down in 2 days. I seen a picture of your account counting down from 0, and the server erroring. I wanted the players to injoy there last two days, so i leveled your skills for the two days, then deleted your account right affter the two days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276605643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1478759693}
review:
Terrible! and Painful!
I got to see the commands for a couple seconds, then couldn't find them again. There's no obvious button to see the commands again,
You click on things to or people to target them, but have to use the CTRL key to attack or interact with them, trying to pick up an item, it's no longer the CTRL it's the space bar. Fishing and forging weren't intuitive or smooth either.

I don't mind limited graphics, but the animations are painfully slow, it's like I've got to unfurl a wand every time I attack. 
I set it to full screen and my graphics card fan had to kick in, that doesn't make sense with an R7-260X.

I tried to get out of the first area in the tutorial by going to the door, it said to use CTRL to open the door with a key, I tried again and again, to find out later that I had to get and finish a quest to kill some rats to get the key I didn't have. 
Why didn't they tell me to go see that person to get the key? And this is your very first quest. It's a small area, but still it needs to be done better.

In the second area I killed some beetles and picked up multiple keys, they didn't stack in the inventory, so I tried to drag and drop them out of the inventory, right click, left click to get rid of the extras, nope, can't get rid of things that way. Once again if there's a way it's not intutive.

The quest window leaves a lot to be desired, click on the icon for it and you get the name of your quests. You would think you would simply click the quest name and it would tell you all about it, no, you click the name and then one of 6 + signs to get bits of information about the quest, who knows what each + sign will give you.

I've played better games than this on a Commodore 64!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026718272', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1478673987}
review:
I can't even be nostalgic about this game. 
I played a lot of grindy RPGs when i was a kid. Tibia, allods2, UO and others. That is why i was excited to try this game out.

You may make a game with oldschool gameplay and graphics, but there is no excuse for making a terrible unusable interface in 2016

This game is not oldschool it's just really extremely bad

Also, pls, mr. dev, add volume slider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302704652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3247, 'last_played': 1513032772}
review:
Orake is a great game, with a great community, content and future. Really has that classic old school RPG feeling to it. Reminds me of the old days of Runescape. The developers are always working hard to interact with the players and involve them in the future of the game, listening to ideas and taking note of issues. 

I have recently purchase a membership in the game after player 30 hrs in. for £16.00 I think its great value. 

Orake is in the early days so of course it will have issues, that is the point of a early access release to iron them out before the game comes out fully. However, although frustrating due to having small free time due to work and other comitments. The developers always seem to fix them and get the game running in no time. and usually give players something back for the downtime, which I think most developers wouldn't even think twice about. 

Adam the creator of the game will personally answer any questions you have and will always do his best to help with any issues. 

So I ask you before you write about this game or leave a review on this steam page. Play the game, speak to the community and I ensure you will find it impossible to leave a bad review. 

For all those who have. I can truthly say you have done it in haste without even playing the game, or giving it the chance it so well deserves. Plus its free so shove it up your arse if you dont like it you bloody cheap skates. Go back to mind numbly paying £90.00 for COD doing the same thing over and over again and investing in games which just bring out the same content with a different look. 

Hats of to these guys, they are brining old school back to the masses. 

Trout

author: {'steamid': '76561197983399279', 'num_games_owned': 554, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1493990937}
review:
If you've lost lots of hours grinding in runescape, and you want to grind all over again, here's a diamond in the rough for ya.

It's got wilderness for sweet drops and open pvp. It's got quests, It's got crafting/fishing/mining/lumberjacking/cooking/alchemy. It's got the comfortable combat trifecta of melee, mage, range. It's got grinding since I know you love to grind. It's got a quirky community and a neat quirky owner.

But, it is quite in the rough. The game is still in Early Access. Content is still being worked on, bugs being worked out, server uptime and stability still a rollercoaster. 

If you are easily frustrated, then mark this as follow, and come back after a few weeks of tweaks.

For everyone else, let's get nekkid and rush the chaos elemental!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001291659', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1478128605}
review:
So I have played the game for a couple of hours now and I am very satisfied with the state of the game being in such an early phase of development. 

Here is a list of characteristics I found attractive in the game:

-Game has oldschool 2d graphics that any oldschool gamer will appreciate, you can see your armor change when you equip something, same for your weapon.

-Variety of skills which are leveled through grinding but you are not hard locked into HAVING to level  them, you progress as you feel like.

-No restrictions to classes, you can choose to level any of these three and kind of "specialize" in a mage, ranger, warrior or a mix of two/three.

- Leveling feels impactful, you get significant upgrades when hitting thresholds of levels.

-Community is small but amazing.

-Developer is active in game and with the community.

-PvP is fun and has rewards/risks, there is a specific zone that has good loot but is open pvp with a level range in which if you die you lose your items (which I like VERY much).



Things I did not like about the game were:

-Couple of interface and functionality things like not being able to withdraw stacks of items or lock into nearby enemies.

-Clunky combat controls but the game being in such early phase gives me hope it will be worked out before full release.

All in all I believe if the game gets polished and frequent updates are a thing it will garner a big niche community.

IGN: Sleepwire

If you need help starting out shoot me a PM.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999257075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1511126110}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010426370', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1498333856}

Orake is a fantastic skill-grinding adventure MMO. I have put in about my fair share of hours and keep coming back for more! THe community is fantasic, helpful, and a mixture of mature/seasoned players and adorable inquisitive newcomers. Fun for all ages, and a great alternative to Runescape and other MMOs. Keep in mind while playing Orake that it is still in early acess. Be ready for bugs! Mods and devs are only a message away :D GLHF

author: {'steamid': '76561198046796302', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5052, 'last_played': 1488719678}
review:
I'm going to be honest here. When I first saw the screenshots for this game, I wasn't that impressed. The only reason I decided to play was because I literally had nothing else to do.

What I found was the kind of MMO that you'd see 10 or so years ago, and I mean that in a good way. This started as one man's labour of love. He's no expert at game development, but he laid the framework for all the non-coding stuff in the game.

Orake looks and feels like RS Classic but with a more experimental interface. Bugs often occur (in Early Access) but they're fixed within the day. Content is shoved out like planks from a lumber mill, but it's good content.

This game is not going to be one of your top 10 favorite games. It's not going to try to beat the competition. It's not going to bleed you dry of your money and laugh in your face.

Orake is what it is - a Work In Progress of a game that's going to end up being what Stardew Valley would have been if it was based on RuneScape instead of Harvest Moon.

The absolute best part is that the staff members are active and talk to players all the time. It's the best customer service I've ever seen, and it's the first time I've ever felt that my opinions and suggestions were actually valued.

Speak and you will be heard. This is a truth you won't find in any other MMO.

review: Awesome game!! If you loved Runescape or Tibia you'll love this game!! Extremenly fun once you get into it! review: This is a pretty sweet 2D mmo. I've actually been looking for one for quite some time now. It reminds me of Runescape due to the skill progressions. As you can see i don't have too much time logged yet, but i assure you. I will. I give 8.5/10 as of now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056419607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1476913698}
review:
Like OS Runescape but actually better, despite being a work in progress. For an early acess game its actualy more than playable, i expected shit to be broken and explode but it was pretty fluid. Also what i like is that crafting items (like cooking) is instant and crafts X amount instantly as well, unlike runescape where u have to wait forever per item.

Edit:
After playing it a bit more and doing research, turns out game is another game with engine used as a cookie cutter for people to buy.  A lot of things are stupid ideas or need to be polished. The combat is really stupid. You need to press CTRL (the only button aside WASD) you cannot use your mouse for combat. In addition, to hit someone via melee attack u need to be facing the target and standing in front of them, then press ctrl. This means pvp is not worth it. Because CTRL is the universal button for everything, when you have a Bow and try to talk to a NPC u always fire an arrow.
PVP is terrible, Spellcasting is not worth it, if the target moves out of range the spell stops casting. Melee is not worth it because you both have to be standing in front of eachother and stay perfectly still. Bows seem to be the only way to go for PVP.
I cant find a way to remove quests from my log using the interface. Also I could not find a integer counter sort of thing in the quest details, i noticed one pop up in top left corner when i got a required kill.
I've also heard the Devs dont know what theyre doing. This seems to be true since not much has changed from the original game. The thing is, I am COMPLETELY OKAY with this if the Devs are willing to learn how to script in w/e language i used by this game, and are willing to learn what makes a game playable and enjoyable. In this sense I am ok with the game not being as great as id hoped, because its a learning game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255773198', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1586201657}
review:
I played a small amount of time before making this review, so you may not like my opinion.
THIS GAME IS GREAT.
This reminds me of alot of retro RPG's and it has a lot going for it. The servers may be hit and miss sometimes, but the helpful and welcoming community make up for it. The dev is active alot and is always there to help.

There is one bad thing that as of the 14/10/2016 I believe need to be adressed.

-Key remaping : alot of game use the F1 - F12 system and alot of them allowing key remaps to suit your style. This game doesn't, as chat such as guild and global use chat command keys like ' and ; this is ok, but other players tell me there are trade chats and this doesn't have a key, which is annoying. I own a laptop and use it ALOT, even for gaming... but the F keys bring me out of games I am playing and that can be frustrating. So I remap them. The limited options in this game is a minor, yet definite thing that needs updating.

Other than that the game is great, and could do great things, it just needs a little something more.
I highly recommend this game to any fan of RPG games and as this game is FREE you really should just download the damn little thing and give it a test run.

-P.S.
        Developer, if you see this, plz don't ban meh XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198033848875', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2080, 'last_played': 1611240753}
review: Ein tolles Sandboxspiel mit viel Crafting im Pixelstyle. Die Entwickler geben alles, es geht aber auch oft noch was schief oder es muss am Server gearbeitet werden. Alles mit dem Ziel uns bald ein großartiges Spielerlebnis zu ermöglichen. Es gibt eine Stammspielerschaft die sehr nett ud hilfbereit ist. Das spiel ist tatsächlich kostenlos, aber auch eine Premiummitgliedschaft. momentan kostet diese Lifetime Mitgliedschaft 20 Euro. Sie wirkt sich nicht auf die Fairness aus und bietet keine spielerischen Vorteile. Man kann absolut kostenlos spielen. Alle Crafter, rollenspieler und Retrofanatiker sind hier an der richtigen Stelle aus meiner Sicht. Es werden auch wweiterhin noch mehr Craftingskills hinzukommen. Ich habe dort eine Gilde gegründet bin aber noch aus Mangel an deutschsprachigen Spielern allein. Aber vielleicht schauen ja bald welche von euch mal rein....

author: {'steamid': '76561198208073473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1476187654}
review:
Hello.

I've got about 14 hours on my account for this game. And i'd like to give my review towards this.

Below, i'll be giving you my Pros/Cons about this game.

A little info on what type of games I like: I grew up around games like Ultima Online, Runescape Classic, EverQuest, and even played some MUD's. I like to give games a chance, even if they don't appeal to everyones needs. Usually, what you'll find me playing is old dated games, even new games (Don't get me wrong on this) But I like games with old time graphics. 



Pros -
-The Community  is very great. They'll help you out no problem. You're stuck on something? ask. They'll help you the best they can. And i'm speaking about players within the game. 

-The developer (Only one i've seen so far) Does play the game quite often. And will answer to your requests. He's the 
type of Dev that you'd like to have in most games. 

-Skilling. This game has a wide range of skills from you to choose from. You can train Mining/Smithing(Which is called Crafting for some odd reason?)Woodcutting/Fishing/Alchemy (And some others.) This right here alone is something I give a + for. Seeing as I played runescape for a while. So if you got that itch to go skill. Try this game out.  

-Player created Wiki, This is probably one of the best things I like about this game as well. Part of the community got together (or some) and helped each other create a wiki for the game to help out the new players who really want to get into this. (This is also a Con which i'll explain under 'Cons'

====================================================================================
-Cons The game server disconnects every hour or so. Now, i'm not here to complain about this one bit. This game is still in testing and it's expected to be like that. Due to their VPN.

-An Actual Forum. They have about 3 forums sites which out of honesty, I don't know which one to go to. (In terms of which is most active/recent)

-Player created Wiki. Even though they're creating it and it's in work. This game has been out for some time (from what i heard) Possibly a few months? anyways. It's not completed much and could use a lot more information from players who are experienced and still play the game.

-Death Text 'You got fucked up' is a message you recive once you've died. I mean c'mon now. Can we get this changed? I know it's something small, and out of honesty I should not really be complaining about this. But hey you never know if kids are going have an interest in this game. That kind of pushed me away from this. What a joke.

-The developer. Although, he does speak to the community. He's not quite Mature on what he does. For an example.
Someone was apparently 'ddosing' the server, which honestly you could not even tell the difference seeing as the game is always going down every hour or even 30 minutes. As he was saying these 'Threats' The  dev was not taking this seriously. He'd literally joke with him, asking the community if he should 'ban him, or not' This is another thing that drove me away as well. Something like this isn't right. If it's a game you created, and you're a Dev. You should handle these type of situations more Accurately. Instead of joking around. 

Let's get more into this situation.

The suppose 'Hacker' requested to speak to a player, and spammed the game. The 'Dev' created an account with the player name, that the 'Hacker' wanted to speak to. And they literally Roleplayed. Like seriously? Who does that. Roleplay with a hacker who's over here threatning to take down their server. This was cringe. What should of been done is actions far more sooner. Then to mess with him.

-Server up time/downtime   This game goes down far to often. Due to their 'VPS? or VPN' Apparently their VPS? or VPN goes down every 30 minutes/1 hour. And it randomly happens. You don't know when it's going to happen till it actually does.

-Devs don't really inform players when the game is going to be down for a certain amount of time. Upon checking the forums here seeing as they have 3 forums and literally they're dead. This game has been down for about a day + and no information has been even added towards in on their 'Community Sub' How did I find out about it? a player had said it on that sub that the game was down due to VPS  problems.

-Game Client, When you've downloaded it, it has a site that'll apparently take you to their forums, but that link is dead. They should get that fixed. 
====================================================================================

Final Statement: after reviewing most of this, I'd have to say to possibly stay away from this game until some things are done/changed/acknowledged/taken seriously. This is a great game, and it has Potential for us players who are seeking old games. For us players, who are looking for that MMO Itch that we can't seem to scratch.

Thanks for your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093688295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1495928137}
review:
Un muy buen mmorpg. 

Lo bueno: muy buena jugabilidad, buena comunidad (usuarios educados, respetuosos y con mucho compañerismo), es gratis, dificilmente deja de estar Online.

Lo malo (no son cosas del todo malas, sino que se pueden corregir): solo esta disponible en inglés, el mapa del mundo parece  chico (aun no lo he recorrido todo), en latinoamerica (mas especificamente en Argentina) hay leves problemas de latencia (ping, lag).

Creo que el juego es nuevo y le falta mucho recorrido aun, tiene todo a su favor para seguir progresando y mejorando. 

Para finalizar: recomiendo Orake

author: {'steamid': '76561198197940849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1527462178}
review:
Been playing this game for the past few days, and have been enjoying it a lot. The community is friendly and so are the devs, and i appreciate that they listen to the players feedback on the game. The map is small, but the game is updating every couple days and new items and areas are added so it is always exciting to see the new content.
The only part of the game I am not a fan of is the controls. I don't mind the moving controls, but holding the CTRL button to attack and gather is extrmely tedious, and would be nice if they changed it to a less dull way to attack/gather.

PROS
-Simple to understand
-Fun to explore the small world
-Friendly developers and players
-Graphics are nice
-Tons of stuff to do, crafting and gathering, fishing and cooking, pvp and tons more
CONS
-Tedious gathering/attacking controls
-Quite a bit of bugs
-UI is a bit weird (Like having your items equipped in your stats menu)
-Unstable servers

So far this game is an 8/10, but I'd definitely reccomend this game to anyone looking for a new and fun MMORPG game to play!

IGN: Erin

author: {'steamid': '76561198155173736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1527462174}
review:
This game is without a doubt a hidden gem. As an avid MMORPG player of over 12 years, I have spent many months and many games trying to recreate the feeling of awe and excitement I experienced during my first steps in the MMORPG world. This game is the first time that those feelings were recreated for me. 

To start, this isn't a AAA game. Don't come in to the game expecting amazing graphics, flawless game design, lack of bugs, amazing AI, and interesting in depth lore. If that is what you are looking for, you should turn away now. However, if you're looking for a charming little game, with a vibrant and friendly community, helpful and cooperative developers, and exciting game play that reminiscence of the past, please check this game out. 

Some pros:
-Decent graphics, if you're in to old-school 2d games.
-Extremely active and helpful developers, who are very open to feed back.
-A fun non-toxic community. Honestly this game has the nicest community of any MMORPG I have ever played.
-Very frequent updates (you can expect an exciting medium to large scale update every week)
-Very frequent bug fixes/balance updates (every day the devs work hard fixing issues reported to them)
-A classless skill system (think Runescape stat system)
-Tons of things to do! Explore, train fishing, wood cutting, craft gear, enchant items, kill bosses, fight other players in PVP, kill regular mobs, become a merchant, do quests, chill and chat with other players etc.
-Loot based pvp system. Kill another player and you can collect their gear as reward.
-Guild/party systems.
-The game is ENTIRELY FREE! No need to spend ANY money to enjoy this game.
-As a result of the above point... There is NO Pay To Win aspects. Finally a game where your real life wealth doesn't affect how good you are in the game. No pay to win, pay to progress, pay to advance... Not any form of advantage at all can be bought. 
-Probably more that I am forgetting.

Some cons:
-The control system is... tedious to say the least. The game could use a major re-design in terms of the way controls are handled. Unfortunately the devs are currently very much against re-designing the control system so it looks like we may be stuck with it for a while.
-There are a lot of bugs, however devs are working hard on fixing them as they pop up.
-The servers are unreliable. Expect to be disconnected at least once a day until this is fixed.
-Dev team is small and indie. Due to this, certain updates/changes to the game may be put on the back burner for long periods of time, and take a long time to fully develop.
-UI is hard to grasp at first (and honestly it IS a little confusing... hopefully they re-design this to be more intuitive).
-The community is really small at the moment. 

Over all this game is a 8/10. If they fixed the controls then I would easily change my rating to a 9/10, but the controls do hold the game back from its full potential quite a bit. Hopefully this is changed soon and I can update my rating!

Hope to see more players join this game! If you need some food feel free to hit me up in global chat - I play as a fisher/cooker merchant.

IGN: Storm

author: {'steamid': '76561198155223827', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1500393893}
review:
First of all, this game isn't pay to win and never will be. The devs are working their asses off to fix all the game breaking bugs and crashes, which is a good thing. In a couple days 90% of the bugs will be fixed in my opinion.

You have to grind in this game, but if you like oldschool runescape this game is for you, The PvP system is a bit funky but remember updates will come, this game is in early access.

The dev team is wonderful helping anyone who needs help, and the rest of the players are kind and helpful too.

This game is a solid 8/10 in my opinion. If you aren't afraid to grind a little bit until you can take on the better monsters, and if you need help there are always people online who will help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122607859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5972, 'last_played': 1477516707}
review:
8 out of 10 

(8/30/16) 
there is suppose to be some big updates for pvp to even the playing field for people,
definately try this game out its fun and its free

The staff have done nothing but add updates daily and fix bugs sometimes in real time based on player feedback, I have witnessed over 10+ updates and usually multiple updates every day.

Also the art style is very relaxing for bit art and the artist updates the UI, FX daily.
I feel I should add that this is not pay to win and the dev team have made it clear that they will allow member items to be tradable to non members

also there are many things that need to be refined like PVP and the Economy but I think it stand a good chance to smooth itself out based on the developement teams currernt progress so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284676751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1472025251}
review:
Some of the major issues:
-Bad pvp mechanics
-Terrible balancing of the combat triangle
-Dev team is slow to update
-Major game breaking bugs take forever to fix
-Awkward control setup and you are unable to rebind any of the controls
-Traveling is slow and awkward
-Bank chest bug out on you when you have ranged gear equipped and make it so you lose arrows and are unable to open the chest
-Crashes constantly
-Control scheme of the game opens up as soon as you launch character into the game but disperses if you press any buttons leaving to confusing if you didn't read all of it
-Many new players get stuck on tutorial island and are unable to clear it fast due to the confusing controls


Some of the good
-The owner of the game is on a lot
-Soundtrack of the stolen music is nice to listen to
-Global chat is sorta friendly
-You can grind at non pvp skills forever and not gain any progress
-Feels like a terrible venison of old school runescape hellz yeah nostalgic trip

TL:DR
In dire need of updates but doesn't get updated fast enough. The owner of the game who is on a lot is unable to make any game changes and does not understand basic game mechanics or how to set up test servers before releasing game breaking updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024524165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1511066224}
review:
Classic 2d RPG. I like that you level your skills more than your actual character.

Meaning: chop down trees, your tree level goes up. mine rocks, mining goes up. attack stuff, attack goes up. cast magic spells, sorcery goes up, etc.

The developer is very open to the community. I talk to him on a regular basis. He's very open to suggestion. 2 of my suggestions were taken so far. He just wants to make a great game. 

People have an issue with the fact that this game used to go by another game. That's not entirely true. It's the same engine, which was bought by Orake, and turned into something else. This isn't the first time a game has done this and it won't be the last. If that turns you off from the game, maybe you need to evaluate something in yourself. The first game failed, and this game simply took the engine and made a better one. 

I play relatively frequently under the moniker "Antagonist" feel free to find me in game and ask any questions. 

I am also the creator of the subreddit (@ Reddit.com/r/orakeonline ). Please subscribe!

review:
Regardless what my steam hours show I've been playing this for the past week 80+ hours.

This will bring back memories of your child hood if you played the Runescape classic when it first came out, so many similarties. This is another 2D game done right, it fits jsut right small and cozy. The communication with the development team is amazing dapker one of the dev's will tell you straight up if your idea for Orake fits into their game or not. I also like the idea they will have green chat text players picked for moderation as this will help toxicity and players abusing the game up to bot control. This will be a game I stick will and will help where I can as I will like to see it where it goes.

IGN: Chief

author: {'steamid': '76561198002840092', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2247, 'last_played': 1475782999}
review:
EDIT (8/19/2017):
I would appreciate it if the developer [adambrosio1] stopped telling all his players to come harrass me over Steam friends or this review. I am going to report you for harrassment.

If you cared so much about what people thought of your game maybe you should actually spend some real time and effort working on it.

It's not my fault your game is a rip off. I'm not the one lying to everyone saying its amazing and so much more will come when we know it won't because you didn't create any of it in the first place. I wouldn't have even written this review if you didn't constantly lie to your playerbase. The only reason why you care so much to downvote this review and tell players to harrass me, is that you can't actually fix your game.


REVIEW START:

I played this game before it came out on steam and had the opportunity to speak directly with the lead developer. Although the game has charm and will give anyone who has played Runescape nostalgia, you will quickly run out of things to do and realize the game's problems. This mostly the fault of the main developer and his incompetence. Being a newly created game, there are a plethora of bugs and glitches, even problems that sometimes cause the whole server to crash. While very frustrating, this is expected and should, I hope, go away with time as long as people continue to work on the game.
 
Some of the major issues:
 
If a mob spawns on the same square a player is on, that player and the mob is trapped there until another player comes by and kills the mob. This can even happen in the wilderness (which functions exactly like the Runescape version), and could easily let other players set up to kill them.
 
The combat styles are totally imbalanced in pvp. Archery is by far the strongest combat style due to being able to infinitely kite players while firing arrows. Magic spells have too long cast times and too short cast distances so that players can simply run away if they see someone start to channel a spell. Melee is by far the worst because both the person attacking and person being attacked have to remain TOTALLY STILL for attacks to land. This means you can just run around if someone is trying to melee you and avoid everything.
 
There simply is not enough content at this point for the game to be interesting for an extended period of time. If you party with other players to get group xp you will be able to kill the strongest monsters in the game in the matter of a few days. At this point, it's not even worth trying to kill other players because the only reliable way is to exploit bad mechanics.
 
Duplication glitch. I know of one duplication glitch in this game. There are probably more...
 
If any of these mechanics get fixed I'll remove them from this review.
 
Finally, lets talk about ResBak Online. If you've played Orake, you've probably had your game crash at some point and might have seen the message "ResBak Online has stopped responding." A quick Google search will reveal another 2D MMO project that failed. The server and client for ResBak is available Online and after playing it, is IDENTICAL to Orake.
 
http://imgur.com/e0mVmTS
 
Literally the only difference are the sprites used. The source code for ResBak is available online for $30 is very obviously how the developer was able to produce Orake without knowing anything about or understanding his "own" game. The best part is that the main developer I referred to earlier explicitly stated "I created 99% of the content in this game.".....
developer_response: We are making a new engine from scratch :) + when the game was up all of these where fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985401520', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1507685728}
review: So my first experience failed at the first tutorial quest. I did the first quest, killed 10 rats. I got the key for the door. But since I don't know how stuff worked, I clicked the key. Key vanished, door still locked. There was no key on the ground, like with other things you drop(and spacebar to pick them back up). Key is gone, door is still locked. I'm not gonna redo the quest because the game has no failsafe for this kind of "bug". I hailed the chat to get help, got told I had to redo the quest, f*ck that. Uninstalled.
